text:
We were pleasantly surprised by this café in the Tropicana offering a breakfast buffet @ $21. It had an omelette bar & all the drinks you want.  We also got to sample the lunch buffet due to our late breakfast...the change over took about 10-15 minutes. 
The director chairs were a little wobbly/dirty I switched mine with another chair. The waitress was very attentive. The food was very good quality for a buffet...which I would recommend....decent value compared to other menu items plus you would have to pay for your drinks too!
Horrible food but they sure tried to make it look pretty. The prices were crazy high for what you get.

The food quality is horrible. I ordered fish and chip but the fish was not fresh and pungent taste. Absolutely worst restaurant to go to in terms of food quality. It was also over priced and the service needs improvement.

Nice breakfast, just ok dinner.  Partly my fault for ordering salad with easy on the dressing.  But the lettuce was ice cold and not crisp.  The reason for keeping lettuce ice cold is to crisp it after a wash.
But the one thing to really point out is please dont ask us to voice our room number and name.  Take a cue from the front desk clerks, who point to your room number and they talk a little softer.  On the surface, the wait staff are being personable and friendly, but then act a little offended when my sweetheart (with a hotel security background) asks to write it down instead of announce it to the room.  Maybe no one is listening, but he's barring on the safe side.

Stayed at the Trop for vacation and ate breakfast here. Steak and eggs with hash and toast. It was pretty good. I ordered my steak medium-well and it was a little overcooked. My boyfriend ordered a medium steak and his was perfect. They do have a breakfast buffet but we opted to order off the menu. Service was pretty good. This is a good place if you are looking for a quick breakfast.

The food is very good, though overpriced. However, the service was so appallingly inefficient and slow that it ruined the meals (we ate there twice since we were staying at the tropicana.)

We waited for a table for 10 minutes not because the dining room was full, or that other people were in line ahead of us, but because the hostess took our name down and disappeared. Our waiter disappeared on us too, but that was because the manager apparently wanted to meet with all his waiters in the middle of service. On a separate occasion, patrons at several tables just got up and walked to the bar to get refills on their drinks. Surreal.

First time in Vegas, she brought us the wrong drinks twice, took our order down wrong more then once, and she wasn't even busy, she also messed up another tables order right next to us, needless to say I will not be returning, just curious as to how the hotel staff is...

Took my wife and son to eat here this past weekend. We ordered the fish and chips and beef and chicken club sandwiches. All the entrées tasted amazing, were well presented, and hot out of the kitchen. Atmosphere was pleasant and the staff were courteous. Had we not purchased tickets to the "Raiding The Rock Vault Show", which was also playing in the Tropicana, we would have never stumbled across this place. The next time the wife and I go to Vegas we will definitely be stopping in here for a bite to eat. The only bad note: the chairs, which were very loud, creeking and very much wobbly. Overall, a solid 4 stars
Incredibly slowwww service despite lots of staff. Delicious mahi mahi sandwich and good fries. The shrimp scampi was clearly a moneymaker dish for them (profitable, I mean).

My very 1st visit here and it was horrible although the food was presented nicely in most cases it was sub-par and lacked flavor. The theme has nothing to do with the restaurant's name. It lacks any kind of actual atmosphere. The service was worse than the food. It took our server about 10min to even come to take our drink order. Then another 10 to 12 to have them brought over. After the meal server came by to see if we were ready for a check. We were! Still another 18min to get it. Keep in mind we were there for almost an hour server came by four times including bringing the check. I'm not one of those people that need to be checked on constantly ,but atleast once to see how the meal is going would've been nice. I don't recommend it at all. But hopefully they will under go some changes soon as I like there location and pricing. Maybe even bring me in to consult as I believe my ideas for the place could only help! Sorry for the length

First time in Vegas, they would not check us in so asked us to check beach cafe. What a horrible service order of pancake took 1 hour at 2 am 
Would not recommend at all

Beach Cafe has been our lunch spot during our week long stay at the Tropicana.  We've had the burgers, wraps, sandwiches, and salmon plate. Everything we have ordered had been absolutely delicious and the service has been great.The only reason I didn't give a 5 star rating is because it does take a while to get your food but I still highly recommend it.

Went there today based on recommendations from Yelp.  Had to wait 20 minutes for a table even though empty tables were readily visible.  Hostess said the way was because of a lack of servers. Once we were seated, quickly had our drinks and on our way to the buffet.  Buffet is good, not fabulous, but good.  Not an overly large buffet, but it had ample choices.  The Omlette station was worth the trip.  We sat outside and this is one of the few places that is peaceful and quiet to enjoy a meal in Vegas.  Great place to sit and have coffee awhile.  I would go back, but for the 24.99 for the buffet, I would expect them to be properly staffed.

Food was edible but really odd choices - "Asian menu" was a section, but was sweet and sour chicken, a "big bowl of wonton soup", veggie spring rolls for over $10. The rest was general American. I had spaghetti with meatballs. Eh. Not worth $12 - didn't come with salad just a thin slice of dry, over-herbed focaccia. The waitstaff were not happy in their weird uniforms (still not sure about the leather weight-lifting looking belt, with khaki long shorts and white polo shirt). Cheapest glass of wine was $10 - a lot for a place with a number of $10-15 entrees.

This is a true story about our experience dinning at the Beach Café two weeks ago. Our family, which included a 5 year old and a senior citizen, recently ate at the Beach Café.   My wife became extremely ill after eating the Mahi Mahi fish plate which required a 911 call and an emergency room visit.  

Within five minutes after finishing her Mahi Mahi plate, my wife went the restroom not feeling so well.  When she exited the restroom, I knew something was terribly wrong just looking at her face. She appeared extremely flush and her eyes were blood shot red.  She had a difficult time standing, breathing and she said that she had an extremely bad headache.  After suggesting that we should returned to our room, she couldn't stand anymore and almost passed out.  I was honestly extremely scared because just 10 minutes earlier she was just fine.   I immediately called security for a wheelchair because she could not walk and they helped me get my wife back to our room.  

Once in our room, her condition worsened which then included shacking, and vomiting. I had no idea what the heck was happening to my wife.  The sad thing about the entire episode was that our 5 year old, who thankfully didn't eat the mahi mahi, had seen her mother extremely ill.  I honestly thought my wife was having a stroke or heart attack and I would watch her die if I didn't call 911.  I called 911; they came and transported her to the Spring Valley Emergency Room.  Once in the ER, the first question the treating Dr. asked was if she had eaten fish prior to her symptoms.  My wife was diagnosed with Scombroid Fish poisoning which is bad handling, bad refrigerated, bad fish!  

My wife was treated in the ER for six hours with medication to counter the reaction to the fish poisoning. Eventually she was released and we went back to the hotel to rest. We had originally planned to leave that day, but due to her inability to travel, we had to stay another night.  She couldn't travel because she was still dizzy and nauseous due to the fish poisoning.
 
Once back in the hotel, I contacted the food manager who was only available by phone. I explained to him our horrible experience at the Beach Café.  The food manager stated that he was sorry and that he would contact me to see what he could to in order to compensate for my wife's ordeal.  At the time, we didn't really want any compensation other than maybe a discounted night since we couldn't travel. Well, he never called me back.  When check out time came around and still no call from food management or hotel management, I decided to visit the front desk and complain.  I was honestly upset for the lack of interest from management.  I definitely think that our family had every reason to be upset.  Wouldn't any rational family be upset if they experienced what my wife had experienced? I again spoke to the food manager by phone and he ultimately stated that neither he nor the hotel management could do anything regarding my wife's (diagnosed) fish poisoning incident at the Beach Café.  He did say, though, he would forward the case to risk management. Oh, and by the way, the hotel was supposedly sold out for that following night and we needed to leave.

Well, long story short... A very nice lady/supervisor at the front desk, overhearing my phone call, told me that she could possible get us a room at a discounted rate.  Thankfully she was able to find our family a room for 50 dollars off and no resort fee.  I didn't care how much I had to pay as long as my wife didn't have to pack up and leave.

We have since contacted an attorney, filed a complaint with the health department and now I'm posting this review on yelp in order to warn others of this potential dangerous situations.  This is a true story from an honest family.  I work law enforcement so I consider myself truly honest.  Please be careful and think twice before eating at this Café.  We will never eat here again due to obvious reasons.

Café Nikki's breakfast buffet was wonderful! I'm not a buffet fan AT ALL but when it involves fresh ripe fruit, yogurt, house made granola, fresh squeezed juices and good coffee, I can be convinced. The patio overlooking the pool is a great place to dine as well.

Nice place to eat lunch in the Tropicana Hotel.  We enjoyed are lunch here and enjoyed the view of the pool and courtyard.  It didn't break the bank either.  If you are staying in the hotel, it's a great place to go to after sleeping tip noon.

We ate here for lunch/brunch on a Sunday.  There was a small breakfast buffett which looked really good for like $19 or so.  We just decided to order off the lunch menu.  We both got sandwiches.  I ordered a Turkey sandwich with bacon.  It was great.  A very good sandwich.  I was happy.  You have the option of either fries, salad. or fuit with your sandwich.  I went with the fruit.  My wife ordered the chicken sandwich with avocado on Texas Toast.  It was very good although the Texas Toast was maybe too hearty and buttery for her liking.  But it was really good.

The service was very friendly.  Because they didn't have any normal size glasses and had to serve my wife's soda in a small glass, they didn't charge us for the drink.  The restaurant seems very clean and spacious.  Lots of windows and has a very open, relaxing feel.

Most people appeared to be getting the breakfast/brunch buffett.  It did look good.

Aufgrund der Personenzahl und des individuell verschiedenen Frühstücksverhaltens haben wir uns für die Bestellung per Menükarte entschieden. Sollte man nicht tun; ist einfach zu teuer.
Ds angebotene Buffet ist dagegen mit z.Zt. $18,90 aufgrund des reichhaltigen Angebotes (u.a. versch. Sorten frischen Obsts, frische Zubereitung von Pancakes usw.) günstig.
Je nach Andrang muss auf freie Plätze gewartet werden.
Man sollte nicht zu spät zum Frühstück gehen, sonst kommen die ganzen Nachtschwärmer und blockieren einen schnellen Zugang.

We recently stayed at the tropicana for a week and used this restaurant most days for breakfast.

They do a breakfast buffet for $18.99 which includes the usual coffee, tea and juice for some reason it's not really well advertised on the menu or in the room but they do tell you about it upon arrival at the restaurant. 

We really enjoyed the breakfast here but be warned it is a lot smaller than the mega complex buffets like MGM across the road. The key for us was that it allowed a slightly healthier start to the day but still with the treats like pancakes. They do a nice selection of fresh fruit, granola, oatmeal, pastries and freshly cooked egg station along with a daily changing options like scramble of the day, pancakes, biscuits etc. I would recommend you check out the buffet before opting for it in case try don't have what you want that day due to the more limited options but saying that we were more than happy!

The service was top notch attentive without been intrusive. They also have a nice outside patio should you wish to sit out overlooking their lovely pool area. If you're staying at the tropicana and want an easy hassle free start to the day then I would recommend this restaurant to you!
Our server was pathetic.. Pat, u really suck. He took the order but did not place for 15 mins because he was busy making a cocktail.. Food was okay. But service was pathetic..

Very good about having reservations. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Food was so-so. My 12 year old cousin had chicken tenders that were ok. I had the grilled chicken sandwich, and didn't realize it had a chipotle mayo on it. It came on texas toast that was soaking wet from the mayo on both sides, and it didn't have lettuce/tomato/onion like the waiter said it would. They were great about quickly fixing the problem, but the chicken was dry and rubbery. Nice staff, and nice view of the outside grounds, but I wouldn't go back for the food.

Day 1, Sat: Like another reviewer, I was SHOCKED at how nice the Tropicana was considering what I've heard! The remodeling is wonderful (even though I'm afraid to tell people that because I'm really in love with their prices right now). We meandered down from our room seeking a champagne buffet and fell in love with the $25 one they offered because unlike so many other Vegas champagne buffets, the food actually tasted good! The fresh fruit and omelette station were incredible. We had a nice corner table on the patio and enjoyed the view and beautiful weather, and our server Stephanie and busser Kevin made sure we were happy and our glasses were filled! Perfect morning. 

Day 2, Sun: Eh. We returned because we had such a great experience the prior morning. We asked for Stephanie but she was working inside, so we had another server because we wanted to enjoy some sun. Of course, the food was great again but the service was lacking. I didn't catch the name of our server but he was either too busy or inattentive to return to our table very often, and when he took a break his replacement just seemed upset with our presence. (To be fair to the relief guy, though, he seemed new and flustered.) Needless to say, we missed Stephanie and Kevin.

Had we had a little better service on Sunday, my four stars would have gone to a five. All in all, though, I recommend heading to Cafe Nikki if you're looking for a yummy breakfast buffet. At $18 without champagne and $25, it's definitely one of the better buffets on the strip! Great atmosphere, great food, and possibly great service.
The food is really yummy here! Their grilled cheese, chicken sandwich, and lobster lollipops are delicious! The service is a bit slow though.

I absolutely love this place!! They offer a lot of great, delicious meals for a very reasonable price which is hard to find in Vegas. Their selection has a lot of variety: there is something for everyone. I ate here several times during my stay and I was not disappointed one time. The chicken fried rice and the chow mein is really delicious! I also enjoyed the salmon entree and the burgers are so juicy and flavorful. The food portions are adequate.  I am a very picky eater and I had not one issue with this place. Atmosphere is very chill and relaxing. The staff is also very professional and accommodating.

Went for dinner before a show.  Ordered the prime rib.  When it arrived, it didn't look like it was cut fresh.  The outside was extremely dry.  The au jus helped, just a little.  I was very disappointed.
Hoppin'! Best spring rolls 4 happy hour!
Good food and ok prices.  The servers are nice but the service is really slow
Good food and atmosphere. I had the smoked salom salad which was really good. Service treated me well and got me everything I needed.

So where do I start. We have put in an order an hour ago yet we are still waiting. There are only 4 tables that need to be served so I wonder what happens if this place is full of people. The waiter says it takes an hour to make a chicken sandwich. I have Cooked chicken before many times and it never took an hour. The waiter was soooooo rude. Never again!!!!!

Took family of 5 for breakfast, enjoyed the meal, had a good server. Ordering off the menu was more appealing than the breakfast buffet for us. We all agreed better than going to IHOP. I would day it was worth the wait, but they seemed to be understaffed. It took a while for our server to attend to us, but once that happened, he did. Fine job.
20 bucks  for a soup and sandwich buffet where the featured dish was pastrami in a  warming tray. Chairs felt like cheap beach furniture. Not worth the money just to eat in a trendy hotel.

My first time in Vegas and got a cheap deal to stay at the Tropicana. On day 1 I tried a popular buffet in the strip for brunch and I felt ripped off. The line was too long (40 min wait), the buffet was pricey ($40+) and food was nothing extra ordinary.
On day 2, I thought I would check out this South Beach cafe located inside the hotel. The buffet was only $21! The set up was simple and nice. I chose a window seat and attacked on the buffet. Again, the menu was nothing out of this world, but it seemed adequate and tasty enough. The stuffs were very nice. There was an omelet bar included in the buffet. I was so happy with food, service, and price that I went to eat there again on day 3!
I was gonna give it a 4 if it was any other city. But for the friendly stuffs, zero wait time, and the reasonable price - these all added up to be a 5!
Food was good. Service was terrible. Our server never asked what we wanted to drink. The ranch we requested came till we were almost done with it.

There is no "beach cafe". It's cafe Nikki and the patio area is called Nikki beach. Confusing. See reviews for cafe Nikki.
Breakfast bar ends at 11 am.

It's kind of funny that the site posts so many a la cart menu items because every time I've come here, there's just a brunch buffet. The second time we came by, we decided to try it. We were really hungry and didn't feel like walking around. The buffet was pretty good, lots of brunch regulars and a few items that I don't usually see. It was pretty busy. The inside was really nice and you can tell that Trop really made a big effort renovating and making everything look new again. It was bright and sunny (by the pool), so the ambiance was really nice.

To be perfectly honest,  the service was NOT good.  It was super slow...like a snail stuck in molasses in rush hour traffic.  

Our first server was nice when present but then we got a new server, right away she expressed how much she didn't want to be there. Seriously?  Anyway, the server got two of my friend's order wrong and completely forgot to get drinks and napkins that we had requested.  They were so unprofessional and played the blame game... It wasn't me, it was the cook, etc etc.  It doesn't matter, just do your job, lady!  It couldn't be that hard... half the restaurant was empty and it was the tail end of LUNCH!

Despite the bad service, there were some good aspects to the Beach Cafe. The interior was modern tropical, very much like the theme of the hotel, and had a good view of the outside/pool area.  My food was super delicious, but my some of my companions had a different experience. 

::Sigh::  Too bad the service sucked.  This place would have gotten a better rating.

The turkey croissant Sandwhich was a little bland, croissant was hard from excessive toasting or grilling. However one of the best cookies and cream shake, rich creamy taste, that comes with three different types of cookies.

Been to this restaurant twice now & sat at the bar. The first time my husband had the filet mignon wrap with truffle fries ( he loved it) & I had the grilled cheese. I must say it's the best grilled cheese I've had. Perfectly melted throughout and not greasy. Second time he went with the Reuben & I stuck with the grilled cheese....both lived up to expectations! To make things even better locals get a discount.... Gotta love that!

I have had fish tacos many times before, but this was my first time here.  The fish (cod) tasted like it had been reheated a few times. The tortillas they were wrapped in were hard, and chewy - my jaw has never had a workout from eating fish tacos before.  The fried tasted reheated and over cooked.

The chicken in my wife's Cajun pasta did not taste right either.  We did not finish our meals, and did not stick around for dessert. 

Overall the it was quiet enough to have a conversation, but as far as the food we were not impressed.

We stayed at the Tropicana, so this Cafe was very convenient and surprisingly excellent. We had 3 meals here. 2 Breakfast and 1 Dinner. The salad was very good. The breakfast off the menu was very good as well. The CB Eggs Benedict was very good. The Panchetta bread was good. The Chicken Fried Steak was good and LARGE.

Came here unplanned and starving, as our group was rushing to get to Tropicana in time for our daybed reservation at Nikki Beach and skipped breakfast in the process. Cafe Nikki was a very pleasant surprise!

I feel sort of bad pointing this out, but the hostess uniforms were so...weird. Long, past the knee grey skirts, black long sleeved cardigans, and black rounded toe flat shoes. Kind of threw off the beach vibe of the place. But they were very friendly.

I took one look at the menu and decided to just go for the brunch buffet, which was something like $2 more than the cheapest sandwich offering. Yes, this isn't Wicked Spoon or Wynn, but I didn't mind. The offerings were typical but way, way fresh. The omelet station guy was a crack-up and made a damn good omelet while conversing with me the whole time. Cocktail shrimp was plump and fresh, fruits all ripe, and I generally had no qualms with the quality of any of the offerings.

The service was impeccable! With folks manning the chafing dishes and opening the lids for me, the easy going yet attentive wait staff, and someone who I imagine was in management offering a free customized cocktail to the birthday girl in the group, I felt really taken care of. 5 stars PLUS for the level of service by the staff =)

Something weird to note was that every half hour or so, the ground beneath us would vibrate. My guess is that it might have something to do with a water pump or filtration system for the newly renovated pool area right next to the restaurant.

My experience here and at Nikki Beach has me way impressed with the "new" Tropicana.

The breakfast buffet was smaller than some hotels on the strip, however, the quality was very good. Jessica was our waitress and she was genuine wine and had a nice energy about her. Coffee was very very good a nice strong cup but not overwhelming.  For $21, the breakfast buffet was a good value and I recommended it.

Had the worst experience ever on my vacation this weekend . Came to eat at this restaurant and I ordered a garden salad and has a BIG PLASTIC PEICE in my salad and I bit into it and hurt my tooth. Called management over nicely and she snatched the item And said she would handle it . And she did NOT. She was very rude and took no responsibility for the restaurants mistake .  She comped me my water and salad !  That I will NEVER eat there nor stay at the hotel ever again . I will also never recommend this restaurant .   The restaurant security would not show me the item again. I wounded why!  There process for a incident was very unorganized!!!!

The food  is not bad but the reason why I give it 4 stars is because of Dexter at the bar. He made all the difference. Very chill and funny personality along with being very professional. Great service!

I've eaten here several times as Tropicana is one of my favorite hotels. I've never been disappointed because the food, service and overall experience of this restaurant is top notch. It's no wonder they've earned top marks for excellence!

My mom visited me for the weekend and we met up here for lunch. The food was pretty good. My mom ordered a Reuben, which turned out really good. I ordered the Cajun pasta. This restaurant impressed me with the Cajun pasta. It had a great Cajun spice flavor and a mix of yummy andouille sausage, chicken, and shrimp! I was actually very surprised by this place. It's a great place to have lunch at.

Tough call.  I'd go 3 1/2 if i could, but not quite 4 stars.

We went here w/a group of 7 people, not a huge party by any means, but not as easy as a table of 4, i understand.  Service however, is very slow.  The place was packed on a holiday weekend, but i believe they were short staffed as i saw the manager busing tables while he should be schmoozing guests and ironing out difficulties.

Our first impression was the length of time to get our cocktails.  Over 20 minutes to pour a few beers??  There wasn't an over abundance of people around the bar, so what took so long??  Then the fried calamari came.  I don't eat it, but the consensus was they had no flavor and tasted rather like french fries.

After an hour, we got our entrees.  I ordered a NY Style Reuben.  Now, i don't know where they've eaten Reubens in New York, but they're generally sky high sandwiches w/a ton of meat in them.  For $13, this is what i expected.  What i got was a tasty sandwich w/good flavor, but barely enough to fill me up let alone bring about visions of NY Style Reubens.  The fries were fine, crispy and seasoned well.   

Everyone seemed to enjoy their dinners as well.  Little complaints here and there, but overall, food was fine.  Would we eat there again??  Probably, but i'd hope next time to find them appropriately staffed.

Light and well decorated restaurant. I guess they assume you'll do the buffet for a Sunday brunch because there were very few options for breakfast on the main menu. Good bloody Mary and the French dip was tasty. Tasted much like a steak and cheese because they put provolone on it however the au jus was spot on. The side salad was a bit lacking.

Pretty traditional Vegas restaurant.  Nothing over the top here.  The renovation from the previous cafe in the Tropicana is mostly cosmetic but at least you don't walk away feeling the need of a shower.

Has a nice coastal vibe with cool colors and beach-like feel.  Depending on your seating situation, you can have a nice view of the Tropicana pool waterfall.  They have both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff is friendly and the food tasty.  It's a bit more expensive than the previous cafe but the food is also so much better with good portions.

This review is regarding breakfast:

Fantastic buffet breakfast. Some of the best lox (smoked salmon) I've seen at a breakfast buffet in a LONG time. Excellent berries and fruit and honestly everything either looked or tasted good. There was a really nice setup for hot tea- it looked somewhat artistic. The man cooking eggs/omelets did a great job also. 

The surroundings are so nice at the Beach Cafe. It's really bright, airy and modern. It's a really beautiful place and not over the top like many Vega$ spots.
Manager suggested the frosted flake French toast and oh man my mom and i about died with how amazing they were. Great staff and amazing wonderful food!!!! Must stop place when in Vegas!!!!!!

A friend who was staying at the hotel took my ex and I to dinner there.    

He ordered the smokehouse burger which he said was good, I loved the black bean burger (Vegetarian) and our friend had the Turkey/Stuffing dinner.    

Service was very slow, not only did it take them 10 mins to get to our table with water and to take our order but it took almost 30 mins more to get our food.    

Our waitress was friendly but she only checked on us once, right after the meal was served, our friend was out of coffee after a few minutes and she was never given a refill + I ordered fruit with my Burger, Fries were brought out, The waiter said he was sorry and would bring fruit but this was never brought out till we were getting ready to leave.

Hey, The food was good...the service just was not up to par and we are good tippers at 20% if we are happy, in this case we were not.

Our friend has invited us to the breakfast buffet in the morning, different staff/different element so I suppose we shall see how that goes, IF we go.

This is a review of breakfast buffet on a Friday. The service was excellent from two separate servers Kevin and Brian. A third person checked on me also.  The place has a pleasant neutral color atmosphere with a view from many tables to outdoor pool and garden area. Clean pleasant functional but no wow and no meh either. 

The food is really what's important and you get what you pay for in Vegas $$$$. 22.95 for breakfast buffet is middle of the road and that's what you get here at best. Fresh fruits cut up and whole, oatmeal, omelette/ egg station, 6 various egg, potatoes bacon sausage French toast etc steam tables.  Pretty small selection as Vegas goes.  A half dozen pastry selections is all. I would not avoid this place but I would not make an effort to try it either.

We were at the JFK exhibit at the Tropicana and wanted to have dinner after viewing the exhibit ( a very interesting exhibit but very overpriced for what you get. But that will be a topic for another review). We found the Beach Cafe and felt the price point was pretty much what we were looking for. I ordered the Cajun pasta. It was a nice sized portion with tons of sausage and shrimp mixed in with the pasta. The sauce had a little bit of kick. Not too much for my gringo palette. But it kept it interesting. My wife had the Portobello Philly sandwich . It was a fairly large hero sandwich with a large grilled portobello mushroom and other sauteed vegetables in it. It was more than she could eat in one sitting and very delicious. One of our friends got the glazed salmon. It was a generous portion with a very nice presentation. And it was cooked to close to perfection. Our server, Flora, was very attentive. To make matters even better, because we are locals in Las Vegas, we got a 25 percent discount. Very very nice. For a strip hotel cafe, this was an excellent meal and a very good choice for what we were looking for.

Nice coffee shop at the Tropicana. Really good chili (no beans style!), good grilled cheese sammich (went nicely with the chili), and a decadent red velvet cake!

Service was pretty good, with the exception of the hostess. Went there twice during a stay-n-play mini vaca, and each time the hostess (same gal) came off rather sour. Like she couldn't care less.  In fact, I don't believe I saw her smile even once!  :(  
Unfortunately, the decent food did not make up for her cranky attitude.

Six of us gathered here for dinner. We happened to come in during happy hour (4-7 PM, M-F) and I was more than happy to order a $5 mojito. A decent drink. 

There was hardly anything vegetarian on the menu, so the sushi chef made me a custom veggie roll. It was ok. 

The ambiance is nice and our server was great - but I'm pretty sure we were his only table at the time. 

Nothing was good enough to make me want to go back.

This is actually my 3rd visit here. As a local with a Trop Plus card coming here is a great deal. Today I had the Salad Bar. Very healthy and includes wraps, soups, tacos, sliced ham and turkey.  Very comfortable atmosphere!

Of all the places to eat in Vegas, this was my least favorite. Not because of the service or the incredible views of the beach like atmosphere outside, or the fabulous back patio complete with bungalow furnishings... only because of the food. 

The burger was over-cooked when asked for medium rare (it was more like well done), the garlic parmesan fries were dripping in olive oil to where they became soggy after a whole minute, and I really didn't like the caesar salad. The dressing was thicker than necessary, and it was over peppered to the point where I was coughing. 

Our waitress was so nice though. She gave us great locations for bars where all the locals go off the strip, and they turned out spectacular. 

The drink selection is really cool though.

Nice little cafe with a good sandwich/salad buffet. You make your own sandwich with different fresh breads, a wide variety of coldcuts, and a fun selection of cheese. The broccoli cassarole was a bit sticky and goopy, and some of the potato chips were stale, but both were tasteful.

Service is fine. The waiter brought my milk and a water, too, which I did not ask for, so I was pleased with that (I needed the water as I relaxed for a few minutes after I ate). Nice dessert choices and a very comfortable and attractive dining room made my visit very happy.

I am a local and I will definitely be back to the Beach Cafe.

After a weekend-long bachelor party, I found my body full of steak, booze, and more in-and-out burger than it's had in the last 35 years of it's existence, combined.

I woke up the morning we left craving breakfast. a nice breakfast. Where I sit down and have a nice server, no blinking slot machine lights, and some good old fashioned comfort food.

I found it here.

I went with blueberry pancakes, and they were fantastic. Big, Fluffy, and full of all sorts of booze-soaking qualities one looks for when dining in early AM Vegas.

On top of that, the restaurant is sort of back and out of the way from the main casino floor.  After a long weekend of dinging, buzzing, and dim-yet-still-must-be-daytime lighting, It was refreshing to sit by a window in a nicely lit atmosphere.

Four stars, and It's going to become a standard end-of-week stop off the next time I'm here for a conference/convention/liver evaluation.
Locals Discount has been discontinued. Generally speaking the food is ok but $26.00 for a breakfast only buffet is ridiculous for the menu of cheap items presented.

I have to say I was very impressed with their food... Small menu but that's okay my husband and I were able to both find something on it I had the Cuban sandwich it was a nice size and they have really good French fries we didn't know what to expect going into this restaurant but we needed a bite to eat prior to going to The Laugh Factory! I definitely enjoyed the food here

nice decor (see my pics I added). Get the buffet for breakfast. Pretty good and you can get your food faster.  Drinks are included in price like coffee, o.j., juice.  If you want your eggs any way but scrambled, you will need to order from the menu.  $14.00 for buffet and $13.00 for fruit bowl.  You can see why the buffet is a better deal.

No Frills coffee shop.  Today's menu offering:

Angus NY Steak & Eggs
Pan Roasted Chicken w/ Peppercorn Cream Sauce
NY Stead Dinner
Skirt Steak Pittsburgh Salad
Calamari

Everything was ok....nothing special.  Calamari was the only negative..... soggy, oily, with a bland marinara, mozzarellas slab and some julienne fresh basil..........ummm..... never again....... Service was pretty good though. Made a nice effort to check up on us.  Hotel going through a nice renovation, but its impossible to keep up with the jones.... Put a dress on the joint and its still a pig.

Worst buffet ever and especially for what they charge you. And the guy working the omelet station is horrible. Argued that the omelet i ordered wasn't what I ordered and gave me another customers order. This place isn't busy by any means. You have two omelets in front of you. How hard is that to manage? Undercooked bacon and undercooked sausage. No selection. And no flavor to anything.

For breakfast, you have the option of either the breakfast buffet or to order off the menu. I was able to try their buffet as well as order off the menu.

Their breakfast buffet has a wide variety of fruits, yogurts, potatoes, breakfast meats and pastries. They even have an omelette bar, with lots of vegetables and meats to put into your omelette. They even have the options of egg whites, whole eggs or egg substitutes. If you're appetite is big, the buffet is a great option.

As for their breakfast menu, they do have a variety of options, but nothing really different stood out. But their cuban breakfast sandwich was delicious, a little too buttery, but still delicious. The fried egg, melted cheese, cilantro aioli and toasted sourdough bread was a great combo. And instead of the potatoes I substituted it with the corned beef hash, which was to die for. If you come to Beach Cafe for breakfast be sure to try their cuban sandwich and/or the corned beef hash.

I stayed at the Tropicana during my most recent trip to Vegas and came here for breakfast before leaving for the airport. I go to Vegas a lot so I've dined at lots of places all over the strip. We came here early enough to do the breakfast buffet, which I highly recommend. The breakfast buffet costs $18.99. The breakfast options on the menu were in the $12+ range so it's worth it to do the breakfast buffet since a lot of the options on the menu were available in the lineup. 

The restaurant is bright, clean, and a little on the small side. I actually like the fact that this isn't a huge mega buffet like most Vegas hotels have. The food was very fresh and delicious. All the stations were also very clean and neat. I usually don't like buffets because I'm a germaphobe and the openness makes me nervous. A lot of the dishes here were covered up in metal servers, which kept the food warm. 

After gorging on rich fatty foods during my trip, I appreciated the healthier options available here so I could eat lighter. My belly was really not having any more of my abuse by the end of my trip. The custom-made omelet I had was nice. I wish they had more mix-in options but they have all the standard fillings like onion, tomato, bell pepper, mushroom, and spinach. I also liked the berry yogurt with their custom granola and fresh fruit. There were lots of fruit options including blackberries, watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, mandarin orange slices, and lots of other healthy toppings like nuts and dried fruit. 

The service is friendly. We all came here dragging our suitcases since we were getting ready to leave and they let us have a table with enough space to set the bags aside without them getting in anyone's way. I know that was a tacky thing to do but we were on a time crunch. When the bill came, our server asked us if the three of us wanted to get separate checks. That was very considerate of her to save us the trouble of splitting. 

I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a nice quiet place to eat breakfast in Vegas. It's away from the loud ringing of the slot machines and cigarette smoke of the casino. For a moment, I forgot I was even in Vegas. I made a reservation on Open Table before coming but it wasn't necessary. The host who checked us in said that she doesn't even look at Open Table reservations. If you use Open Table for points, keep that in mind. My account still says the points are pending so I don't know if I'll get them. That's a minor annoyance. If you're looking for this place, look for signs pointing to CAFE NIKKI. It's in the food court area, a few stops down from a frozen yogurt place.

I WILL NEVER IGNORE BAD YELP REVIEWS.  
I WILL NEVER IGNORE BAD YELP REVIEWS.  
I WILL NEVER IGNORE BAD YELP REVIEWS.

But I did this time... for shame... it was close and we were hungry!  And appetite is the best sauce, so anything SHOULD have been good.  Au contraire.

I know they were trying for a beachy theme, so they had these canvas chairs you might find at some caribbean beach restaurant or something.  But they were so uncomfortable, I wished they hadn't gone so far into their theme.  

I ordered the Cajun pasta.  It just wasn't right.  The meats seemed to be leftovers from the night before or something.  A little tough, generally flavorless (the chicken especially!  That was really bad).  The sauce wasn't anything amazing, fairly bland.  I got heartburn anyway.  

My husband ordered fish tacos.  How can you go so wrong with those!!!  The tortillas were rubbery.  Not even sure how to get that texture.  The fish was boring and flavorless.  And there was no other flavor that stood out.  There was some kind of sauce on it, but not at all memorable, just blah.  

As hungry as we were, neither of us finished our meals.  And it's not like they were cheap.  As we were walking out, I overheard another person mentioning that their fish tacos were awful.  

Hungry?  Try somewhere else, Yelpers.  Learn from my mistake.  Maybe walk across the street to MGM.

Came here for the breakfast buffet and it was great.  The omlette was well made and all the choices were very tasty.  The staff was super friendly and took good care of us. 

This was a first time visit and a must have.
Splitting arguably the BEST Cuban Sandwich we have ever had. Husband is from Florida and we have them EVERY time we go. Truly great!  We will have to come back!
Good reasonable food.  Didn't know what to expect.  Didn't really want to spend the money at a food court in a hotel, but the patty melt was flavorful and smelled delicious.
Out of most seafood on the menu....didn't even  have anchovies for the Ceasar Salad or cracked pepper.

Poor staff, forced to wear unflattering uniforms in beige.  I have no idea what this place was like before the renovation, but we enjoyed the homage to the Bahamas.  White gauze, light woods and the feeling of gentle breezes.  

We waited for an outside table to catch some rays while having the brunch buffet: $17 or $24 for unlimited champagne.  The buffet is small with samplings of fruit, salad, average california rolls, bland bacon mac, and an omelet station.  Toast will cost you an extra $4 (seems kind of chintzy, no?). 

On the bright side, cocktails from the bar are some of the best I've sampled.  I had something with pineapple smash that I still can't get out of my head.

Not really a destination but a must do if you're staying at Tropicana.

Being open 24 hour a day, it's obviously a place for a last minute meal. I had the late munchies but didn't wanna go anywhere far so I chose this place. We had chili and chicken quesadilla. The chili tasted like it came from a can and the crackers that came with it were stale. The chicken quesadilla was alright. Nothing to brag about. It must be Vegas because the meal came it to be close to 40 dollars after tips and tax for something that should've only cost 25 at most. 

Probably won't come back or recommend it to anyone unless it's an emergency.

Food was hit or miss.  Very expensive for the type of restaurant it was.  We were close so we ate here several times.  I guess I am not a fast learner.  I certainty would not go out of my way to eat here.

I had brunch here both mornings I was in Vegas last May. It is a cute, delicious set up with friendly staff and great atmosphere. There's bottomless mimosa and coffee for a little extra and it's totally worth it. The omelet chef made me the best omelet I have ever had! 

Sit out side and get a fun Miami feel overlooking the pool. Sitting on the back patio drinking mimosas was the best part of my Vegas trip. The waiter was super attentive and the manager even came by to make sure we were enjoying our breakfast.

Going back here this weekend with my girlfriends and totally looking forward to it!!!

If you didn't get the free per day spend and paid to eat here, you'd be pretty disappointed. We ate here three times. The breakfast buffet was seriously underwhelming. Like a cheap hotel buffet with not much, and some odd things. For example, they had salmon (lox), capers, cream cheese, tomatoes and onions....but no bagels.   

We then had more money to spend so as not to waste it we thought we'd grab a quick dinner. Took 45 minutes to get the food out. The waiter NEVER came by to say "hey, sorry it's taking so long etc".  So we blamed him and didn't tip him generously.  The next day, for lunch, same thing took at least 40 minutes. This time, the waiter (a different guy) said "yeah, it's terrible, our rule of thumb is if it's out in 25 minutes it's good".  That means it frequently takes way more than a half hour to get food. And I mean you don't even get an appetizer out to entertain yourself until the meal comes out.

The food itself other than the breakfast buffet was pretty good. The Matzo soup was awesome, the grilled cheese sandwich a standout. But if you're hungry or on any kind of time schedule  don't even think about it.

Located inside the Tropicana Hotel. Went here for breakfast and had the option of ordering from the menu or getting all you can eat breakfast from the buffet. The group I was with opted to go for the Buffet. Beware of being offered the mimosas as they are not included with the Buffet Breakfast, and are definitely not worth it for the price.  If I remember correctly they were like 8 or 9 bucks each. The service is excellent, the Buffet breakfast is decent but don't expect anything too exciting. Just your basic eggs, bacon, potatoes, fruit, and some pastries. Would eat here again if I was staying at the Tropicana.

I've really been hoping the Tropicana would step up their game.  Unfortunately my experience today at Beach Cafe provided no such evidence.  I arrived around 11am to an almost empty dining room.  It took close to 10 minutes for my waiter to arrive to take my drink and food order.  First I was brought a cup of coffee I didn't order.  Then, I was presented a plate of food I didn't order.  My cuban sandwich was missing the one single condiment that it was supposed to include; mustard.  Guess one condiment was too much for the line cook to remember.  The side salad was completely wilted and looked pathetic.  Whomever is responsible for quality control/expediting here apparently has no standards whatsoever.  Overall, I was thoroughly disappointed.  Too bad.

Came here for a quick bite to eat before a show. All I have to say is don't be in a rush here. It's super slow. It took forever to get our order placed service was poor the waitress didn't come around much for refills and I had to find her to get the bill to pay. The food was ok I had the cheesesteak and it wasn't anything great. Frys were way too salty and the meat was average. I felt 15 dollars was a little to much for what you receive here.   Overall disappointed
I wish the menu had a more cohesive theme but it is what it is. I had the chicken wrap. It was fresh and very tasty. My bf also had no qualms. It's a bit pricey but hey, it's vegas!

This was by far the best part of the Tropicana "experience". The food and drinks are good and not very expensive and open all night. Dexter was my bartender a couple of nights there. He was awesome! He stood head and shoulders above anyone else at this property! Put him in charge! ;)

My first visit at the beach cafe was not the greatest. Service was subpar we quickly ordered. I was in a group of 3 and there was no greeting really just get to ordering kind of waitress. The restaurant was fairly empty too. As we ordered the waitress did not come and check on us once. We ended up having to ask someone else for the check.

Food quality was not great either I ordered the medium ny strip steak with mash, got a well done ny strip over peppered veggies. My gf got Da club which she really enjoyed but all in all the atmosphere was not one we enjoyed. Food was not great service was not good this is another restaurant I will avoid in the future.

Food is excellent. Very clean, and comforting vibe. My fiancé and I found the staff, and the manager, Joaquin very professional and kind. We have decided to have our day wedding reception here and we cannot wait. This is a great place to grab lunch and I'm confident the dinner is just as good. Highly recommended. Easy 5 stars for us !!

The good:
The setup and vibe is lovely here. Very professional. Prices range from 11 and up for simple items such as burgers and steaks. The food was ok. Not worth $16 for a burger and fries but at 1am, eh.

The bad:
Came here around 1am last night and had to wait 40 minutes for our food. Waitress and host both said it'd be out in a few minutes. I finally asked to speak to the manager and he came over in about 3 minutes. He quickly apologized for the delay and informed us that our ticket had been lost. And he further informed us that our meal would be free. And what made the experience worse was that the waitress only checked in on us after I had to talk to the manager about our long wait.

I liked this place not for great service or stunning food but rather for their value comparison to what is offered for dining within the hotel. 

I came here with a group of 5 to have a last minute dinner and only had to wait about 15-20 mins on a busy night. 

Our server was pretty good. She did make a misstep by not offering drinks before trying to get our food orders. I had the truffle fries to start. They were pretty amazing. My friend had the calamari which was a little soggy but still tasted good. 

I had a turkey dinner and it definitely tasted good. I was over all pretty happy with my dining experience and the price point was pretty reasonable. Except when it comes to their appetizers. They're a little heavy on pricing their apps.

Wanted a change of scene after 2 days at our hotel, so we hopped on over to the Tropicana and found this place.

Now, I feel like 3 stars isn't doing it justice, but we did wait when the restaurant was sort of empty and the service was kind of slow. Otherwise, this may have been a 4 star experience. 

I had the philly cheesesteak sandwich. It was actually pretty good except for the bread. I'm an Amoroso roll snob. It really had everything going for it, except for the roll. 

The french fries were amazing. I didn't order them, but they gave them to me and it was yummy to my tummy. I have a potato bias, though. I just love them.

The side salad was OK, very basic. 

Service was, like I said slow. Normally I wouldn't mind, but we were time crunching it a bit towards the end. The manager was cool and gave us our check and I didn't feel rushed to pay or anything like that. 

If I'm back in town, I'll probably come back. It's a nice place.

Between all the 24-hour joints on the Las Vegas, Beach Cafe is a undervalued gem. I have been here for their breakfast buffet and their late night dinner menu. 

Location: 
Located towards the back of the casino to the side. If you walk past the South Beach Food Court, you are almost there. 

Food: 
Breakfast brunch: Apparently the going-rate for the brunch buffet in Las Vegas is $19.99+. Here at Beach Cafe, it is a few bucks more. The buffet selection is small compared to the Bellagio or Bacchanal but it has high quality items. You also get OJ, soda or coffee with your meal. The omelette station is awesome! 

Late night menu:
 Burgers, quesadillas, chicken wings and other stuff! Beach Cafe is usually very dead late evenings, unless there is a convention at the Tropicana. I love their BBQ Chicken Wings (12 wings for $12). It's spicy and there's plenty of meat on the bones. Quesadilla isn't very good plus it's a very small portion. 

Service & Ambiance: 
Service is good, both brunch and late night. Service employees are attentive and helpful. There's a "fake" Miami Beach atmosphere to Beach Cafe. Palm trees outside and a whole lot of white white white color everywhere. 

Overall, the brunch buffet could improve a bit more, but their 24 hour diner is arguably the best bang for your buck on the Las Vegas Strip. It just sucks it's all the way on the south end of the Strip and there's not much else that the Tropicana offers.

Pretty standard Vegas restaurant in the Tropicana.  Inside or Outside seating.  They do a breakfast buffet in the AM that is about 20 dollars.  I have been twice for the breakfast buffet and it is short on selection, but has pretty good quality (probably better than most others).  I like the selection of tropical fruits and the omelet station had some pretty unique options as well.  All in all it is a standard buffet with a little tropical flair and not a huge selection.
The prices are pretty standard for a general dining establishment on the Las Vegas strip. Besides the breakfast buffet which I have been to a few times I have also had lunch, which features some good selection coming in around 15 a pop.  Everything has that little bit of south florida twist to it, but in the end all the food served is pretty standard, burgers, club sandwiches, basic pasta, etc.
Not the best, but certainly I have seen much worse in Las Vegas. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit Cafe Nikki, but if you are staying at the Trop and need a good sit down meal or breakfast (usually how I end up here) it is pretty much your best bet.  The trop also has a steakhouse (Biscayne) an Italian place (Bacio) and a food court (starbucks, gelato, etc)
Do not order from the bar. Moscow mule is the worst i ever had, and the food ...as well.

The worst breakfast experience I have had in Vegas, didn't get coffee until 1/2 done with meal, no one EVER showed to make an omelette and I could never get a refill on my already late coffee. Expressed all of this displeasure to hostess... Got a "uhh... Sorry, the waitress was busy setting up the poolside for lunch." Well I hope the pool goers tipped because I didn't. Idiots

Ate here for one breakfast and one dinner during our weekend stay at the Tropicana.

For the dinner, the restaurant was pretty empty yet they still sat us next to an obnoxious group of meatheads and barbie dolls. The service was OK, although considering we were her only table our server didn't check up on us very often. As for the food, my burger was tasty enough albeit overpriced as was my wife's chicken sandwich.

I could say the same for the breakfast in terms of quality (again nothing special but expensive), but go one step further and complain about our server George who said he would get me some cream for my coffee and disappeared for at least 5 minutes. On his return he gave the table across from us cream and started to ignore us so I shouted him down. He was completely unapologetic about the whole situation so he was given a tip through much duress! George is a less than acceptable server if anyone from Beach Cafe reads this.

Beach Cafe is your average, run-of-the-mill Vegas dining spot. The whole place has a beach-y feel. It felt a lot like a place we ate when on our trip to Mexico (atmosphere-wise). My biggest complaints about the facility is that the chairs weren't very comfortable and the service wasn't much better. Otherwise, the whole place is pretty "A-OK". 

On night number one, our flight was delayed and myself and my co-worker were starving so we stopped here for a quick late night bite. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and he ordered their mini-burgers. Both were just fine for a meal at nearly 11:30 at night. 

They offer a breakfast buffet for $21 per person which includes your beverage choice of OJ or coffee. I ate here a total of 5 times while on my recent business trip. 3 of the 5 times I was there, the service was iffy. If you're wondering why we went so often....convenience. It was the only breakfast place in our hotel and due to time constraints besides Starbucks (if that even counts), we were kinda forced to eat here. 

The buffet contained sausage, bacon, muffins, mini-bagels, salmon, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, sliced meats & cheeses, cereal, and my favorite...an omelet station! 

One day, even though I requested my omelet "well done", it was quite under cooked and I actually had them remake it on this particular day. I feel bad because the next day, I think the omelet guy was kinda afraid of me. He joked about me coming back even though he knew he messed up the day before so we just laughed it off and he did a great job on day #2. 

Would I go back?? Probably would not go out of my way but if I was in the hotel...maybe I would grab a quick bite to get some food in my tummy pre-cocktail.

The breakfast buffet was fantastic.  Omelette station - highly recommend. Jalapeños and spicy salsa and an egg white omelette with veggies... Really good breakfast potatoes. Nice atmosphere and very attentive hostess. Will definitely go back!!! Convenient since we are staying in the Tropicana

Wings were so dam good! They had so much flavor and we're very spicy tasty and crispy. Perfect wings! The pasta sucked lol the Cajun pasta needs to be revamped, way too much tomato sauce. I would definitely look at changing that if I was the head chef. Overall service was great. Had a free 40.00 lunch comp

What to do for Mothers day?

My choices were many but typically at jacked up rates starting at $45 anywhere decent, just because somewhere like Simons added another station to their buffet...

Do I drop $250 plus for 2 Mom's and a 15 year old just to do it up right?

Then along comes Nikki Cafe, some smart web search optimization brings up Nikki Beach when searching on Google and tucked away is the fact that the cafe is open even though Nikki Beach is not officially launching until May 26th, 2011.

The BUFFET:

Great array of fresh fruit, bacon, waffles, sausage, eggs and your standard fare was all but complete. Ingredients were fresh and routienely switch out. Omelet station hummed along and did a great job of cranking out your choice quickly. Sit around a little (we sat at 11am) and out comes lunch with a very tasty Chicken Pot Pie amongst other treats.

So was Nikki Cafe the best food ever, no... best buffet ever, no... but was the food good and fresh then Yes. Our server Kevin was terrific and and the ball as were all the servers. They need to replace the hostesses though with something a little more senior, pack of 3 girls looking like they had an average age of 14 is not the best way to start but it's easily looked over.

Best part : Value - $17.99 and add $7 extra for unlimited champagne and for less that $25 it's an outright steal. Can't wait for them to finish up the construction as I will be back.

Thanks Nikki, ramp up the food and there are a few of us might drop 5 starts your way next time.

TIP: Ask to sit outside, although windy you are shielded and we spent a very pleasant 2 hours just chillin!!!

Never again.. We decided to have dinner before catching a show at tropicana.. Big mistake, the service was aweful. I couldn't tell you our waiters name because he never introduced himself we barely saw him and when our food finally arrived, half of mine was cold, the cheese on my dads Philly steak and CHEESE sandwich was almost non existent and the fish and chips were bland. We sat for literally 10 min before we ever saw our waiter and they were not busy, at all.. I would give zero stars if I could but yelp wont let me so this is what they get.. Very dissatisfied!!

I'll give it a four because it is fine dining and the food did taste very good, but depending on the meal, I would vote it a 3 or a 4.

Breakfast? 3.  They have a buffet for $18, which is good considering the Vegas prices, but the buffet is not even 1/3rd the size of the good buffets in town, not to mention that all food is just your standard American breakfast food - eggs, sausage, etc.

Lunch? 4.  A little pricey, but the food and service was very good.  We went all out since we had a food credit, but it was delicious.

If you are in a rush for a meal, Cafe Nikki is not a bad choice, but if you had time to plan and go somewhere, I suggest you look elsewhere.

$11 and 25 minutes later, I received a "fresh" teriyaki chicken bowl with what tastes like microwaved brown rice, inedible chicken, and soggy wonton "crisps". This place is a tourist trap for guests of the hotel who can't afford any of the overpriced food on the strip. Oh well.

Being generous with 2 stars.....

Below Average.....

This pretty much sums it up. If you want a below average meal, come here. There are so many better options in Las Vegas. I can only comment on breakfast which was pretty much standard fare. The food here is pretty much what you would expect from a local diner. I didn't think it stood out in anyway. I had the chicken fried steak and it was a bit rough (I didn't finish it) and had lots of gristle. The bacon was good though. The person I was with had biscuits and gravy and mentioned it was "soggy."

I will say that the service was very good. The atmosphere of the restaurant was quite well done (looks like they had an interior designer come in) and the outside dining area was very nice so I give them props for that. 

The Tropicana is a nice hotel, and I would even consider staying there given the recent upgrades they have made. However, I don't think I'll venture to Cafe Nikki again.

We love that we could make reservations - that's always a good start!

Fred, our waiter was pleasant and fun and was great and bringing our cocktails to start us off - and made a great recommendation of the special of the night.

The ambience was casual and laid back which allowed us to be our crazy zapponian selves.

The Appetizers were so good we ordered another round!

Two of my fellow Zapponians ordered the special and the rest of us ordered other dishes but ask for alterations from what was mentioned on the menu - they were able to accommodate our requests, that was an awesome touch!

From what I heard, everyone enjoyed their meal and we all had fun conversations and great drinks.

We came here to team build but also pre game our Benin before we went to see the Rock Vault concert - which by the way was amazing!

I would definitely recommend this place to have a meal before continuing your adventure in Las Vegas!

Thanks Tropicana - shout out to Fred for great customer service! We hopefully will come back soon for another wonderful evening!

:)

EPIC LUNCH FAIL!  After walking the strip to check out the new Bagatelle, my husband and I decided to stop for lunch at this cute cafe next to the pool.  We probably waited about half and hour to be seated, but understood that there was a small line, so we were patient.  After being seated, we ordered and were given  our drinks....and we waited...and waited.  We were seated at 2:00.  At 2:42 I was tired and starving, and annoyed, with an empty iced tea glass.  No one came by to let us know what was taking so long or to fill our glasses.  So I called our server over as she walked by (and she was not easy to catch)  and politely asked what happened to our order.  She said the kitchen was busy and everything was taking a long time.  About 10 minutes later, our order came...and I couldn't believe what was on my plate.  I had ordered a smoked salmon salad that was supposed to have bacon hazelnuts and figs...sounded delicious.  Well, when it arrived, is was some of those pre-packaged lox on a pile of wilted lettuce covered with vinagrette with 2 figs and a sprinkle of sliced hazelnuts. It looked awful, and certainly was not worthy of the $16or hour long wait.   I was starving and did not want to ruin our day, so I called our server over and asked for the bacon that was described on the menu.  She brought over a small plate of bacon.  I poured it on the salad and tried to eat.  I could not cut the lox.  They had gotten hard and dried up.  So I took a bite of the salad and it tasted as though it had been doused with pure vinegar.  The harshness went straight to my stomach and I ran straight to the ladies room for fear of throwing up.
My husband was going to try to eat his sandwich, but when he saw my order he stopped mid-sanwich so we could go somewhere else.  I asked him to eat if he was hungry, but he described the chicken as "rubbery" and was happy to find a different lunch location.  At least they did take the price of my uneaten salad off the bill. 
 
Avoid at all costs.

I've definitely had better service and better food elsewhere.

[SERVICE]
You can really tell that the servers here hate their jobs. They're not very attentive and they look so exhausted. My friend had asked for an extra fork and the person that served us seemed very annoyed.

[FOOD]
I had the philly cheesesteak that came with a side of fries. The sandwich itself was incredibly greasy, I left the restaurant in search for a restroom to wash my hands and looking like I had just put on lip gloss. The fries were good-- if you mess up french fries, you know you're doing something wrong.

One of my friends also said that her fruit salad tasted rotten and like it had been sitting out for a while. We asked our server if we could sub it for a potato salad instead, and AGAIN, the servers seemed annoyed that we were making such a request.

Needless to say, I will not be returning to this place.

Came here for brunch (Friendly tip: make reservations on the wkends. I did and the host said that was a good idea because they were busy)

Anyway, good food..had a fair amt to chose from..maybe 10 items?. Our server was nice and attentive as much as one can at a buffet brunch. They also had choices off the menu but we were specifically for the brunch. We sat by the window and saw Nikki Beach, wasn't alot of people out (yet at least) but seemed like a nice spot...we were saying we were gonna get a cabana or daybed there next time in Vegas.

Only downside is we thought brunch was 17.99 but it was 24.99...not really worth 24.99 mainly because it wasn't hella to choice from. We could had went to the buffet at our hotel for that price...and the 24.99 didn't include unlimited champagne or anything...just water. When we were leaving my friend said she thought she saw a sign stating brunch was 17.99 (wish she would had spoke up when we got the checks but whatev). 

Next time I go back, I will verify the price first and then decide if I want to do buffet or order off menu.

The Tropicana is at once one of the legendary venues of Las Vegas, yet one of the smallest places around.  There is definitely a coziness in the gaming area, but that same small-ness translates to very few choices when it comes to dining.  Thankfully, I found the Beach Café some months back.  While the service could use some needed tweaking, the food is consistently above par.

I have worked in hospitality a very long time, and I find that the term Customer Service is as open to personal interpretation much more than it should be.  First rule:  NEVER touch a customer.  Why would a wait staff feel the need to make physical contact with a complete stranger?  During one of my many visits, my waitress apparently felt that need, and did so from behind me, startling me to the point where she never returned to my table, given my very obvious reaction.  I was tended to by the manager, Mr. Mark Arnold, a truly gifted hospitality professional, who understands service to the nth degree.  On subsequent visits I have asked to say hello to him, and he has taken over my ticket, without my asking.

The food is always good, well-cooked, if a little misunderstood.  The only dish with which I have had any complaint was the fish and chip basket.  The fries were nothing special, though cooked well, and the slaw was above average, but the fish came, literally, in stick form.  The only forgettable meal at the Beach Café.

Better is General Tso's Chicken, of which I have partaken twice.  This version is better than many Chinese places.  Fresh tasting, filling and hot, all at once.  The NY Style Reuben was fun, creamy, crispy and pungent where it counted and more than enough for two meals.  The wraps are delightful and also filling.  

The real treat, however, is the weekend brunch, served from 10:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. Saturday and Sunday.  The restaurant is open 24/7, but the brunch is a real find, if only for one item.  Yes, everything is fresh, tasty and plentiful, including the usual scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, etc.  But the mini breakfast beef, small steaks I liken to baby filet mignons, have got to be Las Vegas' best kept secret.  For the cost of the buffet, $22 plus tax, a meal can made entirely of these tender, juicy, properly-seasoned gems sent from gastronomic heaven.  Pair them with any type of potato, or whatever starch is being served, but be sure to include extra sauce, if only 'cause it's marvelous.

I have yet to have desert, as I am always full by meal's end, but that may change, as I am losing weight and may yet indulge.  If you're out late gaming, having a drink or just walking, stop in and enjoy The Beach Café.  And ask for Mark.

Although our waiter was nice, this was a terrible experience. The restaurant staff didn't even tell our waiter we were his table to start the event off with. He's tried so hard to make our time here better, but bad food and irresponsible management are 2 of my biggest turn offs for any restaurant. My flatbread was soggy, the chicken was dry, and was cold. It took forever to get service. They messed up my sister's order, including the wrong items. And, didn't include certain requested sides for the other 2 people in our parties dishes.

Das Beach Cafe im Tropicana Hotel ist eine einzigste Katastrophe, wir hatten Cajun Pasta bestellt allerdings war das eher ein miserabeller Deutscher Wursteintopf. Geschmacklich katastrophal sehr viel Sauce und kaum Nudel zudem war der Service sehr Hochnäsig absolut nicht empfehlenswert.

Brunch at Cafe Nikki was the most pleasant dining surprise of my Vegas trip. I was staying at the MGM and on the last day of our trip we had 6 hours to kill between check out and when we needed to head to the airport so we decided to venture across the street to the Tropicana to see what they had to offer for brunch. 

The bright, clean, calming beach decor is what drew us in to this place and I am so glad it did. They were serving a brunch buffet at the time so we decided to take the plunge. Buffets had not been too kind to me, or my stomach during my week there so I was a little hesitant....that was until I saw the spread. It wasn't a huge, overwhelming amount of mediocre food but rather a decent selection of some very well thought out choices. It was so refreshing to be able to fill my plate with fresh watermelon, orange slices, grapes, etc. The fruit selection alone made me happy. They also had a selection of yogurt, crepes, cheese blintzes, organic eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage as well as an omelet bar. The bacon was crisp and delicious, not rubbery like the MGM buffet and the eggs were light, fluffy and not overly salted or buttered. I was able to get a good fill of food without feeling weighed down and gross from grease. Plus the service was fantastic, our server was super attentive and personable. Oh and he kept my coffee  filled to the brim, especially after he saw my sigh of relief with the first cup. To make it even better the price was very reasonable. Probably the least amount of money I spent on a breakfast in Vegas.

"Yeah, well I should be in Vegas eating at the shrimp buffet, so give it." - The Big Bang Theory: Season 6, Episode 23

My friends were staying in the Tropicana (and also getting married there), so we met for breakfast/brunch the morning the day before the wedding. The Beach Cafe was able to somewhat accommodate a medium sized group of us as a high top table on a Friday - a couple people ended up at a different table.

Our waitress, Stephanie, was quite lovely and took good care of us.  We could opt for the buffet for $21 with add-ons for additional money, or just order a la carte from the breakfast menu. The items I wanted were neither on the buffet or on the add-on menu, so I went for a la carte and ended up spending about $27 - typical for a good breakfast in Vegas.

I had Corned Beef Hash with a poached egg and rye toast and a biscuit and sausage gravy on the side.  I also ordered coffee and OJ.  The food was pretty good - the egg was perfectly poached and the hash was good - the potatoes were undercooked, however. The hash was a half a step up from the canned stuff, but it was still tasty. Now the biscuit and gravy was quite tasti-licious. 

The coffee was not horrible, it was drinkable, but no raw sugar on the table. Always disappointing in this day and age and the OJ was the right level of pulpy. For $27 I was not disappointed, but I was no blown away. I have had worse breakfasts, for sure. But this is no Wicked Spoon or Hash House A Go Go.
Not a bad breakfast buffet.  Good selection of grub.  Certainly not the Bellagio Buffet, but decent enough.

Wanted a soup. Waiter highly recommended the Udon.  Extremely small portion for $16! Soup was ok and very little noodles.  Think the waiter was embarrassed he had to serve it to me...He gave me a discount & a free salad because I was still so hungry!!

Food: This place has a good selection of food to pick from although the menu is basically only one one page (the other page is just full of drinks). I ordered the rotisserie chicken with mango sauce, plantains, and vegetables (green peas). The food was alright, but the mango sauce was so sweet and overpowering (I didn't really like it). The chicken itself was good though. The plantains and vegetables were drenched in the sauce so I didn't end up finishing it. I do recommend getting the Kobe burger though because it is really huge and it comes with potato and sweet potato fries (even though it doesn't say so on the menu). 

Service: Service was really good because the waitress kept coming by to see if everything was alright and this waiter even came too. The ironic part was that they kept coming by to see how I was when I didn't need anything, but when I needed more ketchup it took me about 10 minutes to get someone to come by. I don't really blame them though because I was basically telling them I was fine earlier. 

Decoration: This place looks really nice and fresh. I was sitting on elevated chairs since the table was high. The place is basically white and beige and everything seemed so modern. There is even a bar that serves lots of alcoholic drinks and there is a view of the pool (although I didn't really see anything since I went at night). There is soft, calming music playing in the background which adds more sophistication to the place. 

Summary:

Food: B+
Service: A
Decoration: A

Closing Comments:

This place is great for late night dinner for those with a light to medium appetite. The setting is kind of intimate and quiet and is great for a relaxing meal. The waiters are down to earth and are willing to help you out with anything. The only downside to the place is that the food is a little overpriced, but then again it's a restaurant in Vegas!

BTW...they offer a buffet option for $24.99, but do not get it because it is not worth it. The selection is very small and when I saw the people clean it up, they fit all the stuff on one cart...Just order from the menu.

Loved the caesar salad and the potato leek soup.  

The atmosphere is awesome - very calm and relaxing.  Lots of umbrellas so you should be able to hide from the sun while being seated outdoors :)

Pretty good place!
So glad I found a place that looks like a proper / normal restaurant in Vegas that doesn't look like an obnoxious place, it's pretty affordable too and food's good.

I got a comp here after a disastrous meal at the South Beach Food Court.  

My girlfriend and I arrived and had a little wait for the table.  We were seated and brought some water, then had a bit of time before the server came and took our order.  My girlfriend got a cocktail and General Tso's chicken, while I got the prime rib & baked potato.  We split a chicken quesadilla appetizer.

The cocktail took a little while to arrive, but my girlfriend loved it.  The chicken quesadilla came next and it was very meh.  First off, instead of a traditional quesadilla, it was 4 mini quesadillas.  By the time we got them it was clear they had been finished for a while and sitting around before our server brought them to us.  We had asked for no avocado or sour cream, but they were still on the plate (though off to the side).  Anyway they weren't anything special and I'd much rather have had a Taco Bell quesadilla instead.

The food took quite some time to arrive.  First off, my prime rib was not that great.  Quite fatty and the only really good part of it was the ribeye cap.  The potato was fine.  My girlfriend's chicken was really good, though a little spicy for her tastes, but her rice was overcooked and crunchy, which was part of the problem we had previously at the South Beach Food Court.  

Service was OK except being a bit slow.  The chairs are the cloth "director" type chairs, which may be uncomfortable for some but we didn't mind.  The prices, for what we got, were ridiculous.  Everything would have come to around $60 had it not been for the comp and honestly we could get a better meal from some of the Stations casinos 24 hour cafes for less than half the price, and that's even including a cocktail.

The food & beverage director gave me a comped meal here in an attempt to show us what Tropicana can do food-wise, but really it varied from average to below average, and to think someone would pay 2x what we really think the food is worth is a bit ridiculous.

I'm sure I will be back to the Tropicana but I doubt I will ever eat here again.

Not bad but not the best. The waitress was nice but perhaps a little hard to flag down for the check and the food was okay. I think the best part was the outdoor dining area. Definitely a plus on a beautiful afternoon. 

The waitress greeted us promptly and with a smile. She seemed knowledgeable and kind. The food was just okay. I got the fish and chips. The chips/fries were tasty but the fish was a little plain. I liked the fluffy batter but the fish didn't have much flavor in itself. A little more seasoning on the fish before dipping in the fry batter would've done the trick. I just ended up dousing it with malt vinegar and a glob of tartar sauce. Didn't care for the side of coleslaw either. It hard an odd seasoning flavor to it. It was reminiscent of Season All seasoning. Not what you expect in coleslaw. 

The hubby got the Philly Cheesesteak. It was decent. The steak was a little dry but the bread was fluffy and the sautéed mushrooms were good. 

It's probably the best place to grab lunch at Tropicana considering there aren't a lot of choices. Just good ol' American food.
This is the typical casino cafe. The view is spectacular of the pool area, but the food menu leaves a bit to be desired. The food is hot and the staff is friendly. I would go back for the basics :)

Steak frites was 1/4" thick and a poor quality cut of beef. Covered with mushroom gravy... Said it came with a mustard glaze   
When I asked the server said "all of our steaks come with mushroom sauce".
