Why?
Also got the chicken fried steak, couldn't be chewed it was so tough. 
Server was nice, albeit clueless. 
All in all, not a good experience. 
Not recommended

I had a wonderful experience here! After a disappointment of a dinner the night before at the steakhouse at Camelot, the bf and I headed here for dinner. I made reservations through open table and we were seated right on time. We had the calamari appetizer, which was very yummy, and we had the prime rib which was great, and their baked potato, truly was a baked potato ( side note: I hate when you order a baked potato, and a boiled potato comes out, to me that says that a restaurant thinks their customers are too stupid to tell the difference, and if they are doing that, then what other shady stuff is going on?). Anyway the dinner was delicious and dessert was to die for. The bf had the creme brulee and he said it was perfect. My apple pie a la mode tasted very fresh and came out warm with some vanilla bean ice cream. Perfect! The bill with drinks, appetizer, dinner and dessert came out to $80. Not bad at all. The ambiance was great, and our server Liz was awesome. I totally recommend this place!

We went for lunch and had a great experience.  The service was amazing and the food was yummy.  The TV dinner with turkey and potatoes was seasoned perfectly and they got the portions just right.  Likewise I sampled some sushi and was please with the presentation and flavor. Best thing on the menu was the Philly Cheese Tater Skins and wanted to order about 5 more orders after tasting the yummy pieces of steak drenched in cheese whiz.  

Later we returned around 6 to meet some friends for happy hour and go for round 2 of tater skins.  Our friend had already ordered all of the appetizers on the happy hour special.  When we joined the group we requested waters and an order of the tater skins in addition to our drinks.  We waited about 20 minutes till we got our cocktails only after flagging down the manager to check on the order.  He was polite and apologized and made sure our server got our drinks, she never brought our waters.  Our food was brought out and it was less than appealing.  The calamari fries were cold, the Pork Carnitas Spring Rolls were a mashed up flavorless mixture, and our sushi rolls looked an off color.   We complained to the manager again because out of the 6 or so dishes about only %5 was touched.  He took it off of our tab and sent the server over to get our drink orders.  We ordered and also asked about the skins.  We still had no waters so one of the persons in our party went and took the water pitcher from the server's well.  After about 30 more minutes we still didn't have our items and asked for the check.  

It wasn't slammed in our area and ironically the singer Ne Yo was across from us and we watched as his table struggled with the same issue of slow service.  We left without ever getting our drinks, the water or the tater skins we had ordered.

Perhaps against our better judgment we went back for a late night snack hoping to get the elusive Philly tater skins.   No luck the bartender was unsure what we were talking about, but was willing to check with the kitchen.  They said they could make them for us and we were delighted to get them again.  Sadly, when they came out they were something different than what we had feasted on earlier in the day.  It seems that there are issues of quality control that are being overlooked here.  It is as if each shift is operating independently of the one previously before it.  Nikki is a new business but I'm hoping they get it together before summer pool season hits.

Great buffet in Vegas! We had the breakfast buffet, paid a cool $21 each and had access to fresh, made to order omlets, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, and pastries! Our waitress even happily brought me some toast since it wasn't offered on the buffet but I was really craving some. Overall, really good experience, clean atmosphere, and fresh food all for a really good price.

Frequently dine here when on business trips. The restaurant is always empty so we can quickly get a table. I love their prime rib, but unfortunately everyone else I as with didn't enjoy their meal. If you go, get the prime rib!

7/6/13  Late Lunch

3.5*  Tropicana has seen better days. It's one of the oldest South Strip hotels in Vegas. I never consider staying in this area because the hotels are old and the crowd is more riffraff. So when we found out that we had to stay in Vegas for an extra day due to a plane crash in San Francisco Airport, we wanted to stay closer to McCarran than the North Strip.

To make a long story short, we settled into our room for a night at Mandalay Bay after we declined the crashpad at Luxor offered to us by United Airlines. My BF had to refill his prescription at Walgreens so we made our tread across the street to the Strip for Walgreens. On the way back we wanted to checked out the new Tropicana, which had a makeover last year. We were curious about it because it was the host of Gay Weeks Las Vegas last fall.

Beach Cafe was tugged away in the back of the casino by the Tropicana bungalows next to the pool. Setting is both vibrant and natural. It's atmosphere is very relaxing and cozy. It was slow when we arrived since it was almost 4pm. We had to wait for a table because they didn't have enough servers. Service was ready and friendly as soon as we were seated.

The menu resembles to like eats from a fine deli. You'll find salads, sandwiches, wraps, and some mains.

*Chicken Quesadillas ($10): the usual affair but with rotisserie chicken and melted jack. Tasty with salsa and guacamole. 

*Roasted Pork Sandwich ($13): on grilled ciabatta with bacon apple chutney. Pork loin is very flavored and the tangy apple chutney balanced the flavor well. The bread is a bit dry and aioli skimpy. I like they allow you the choice of fries or fruit. 

*Apple Pie a la Mode ($7): nothing special. 

Prices are decent. All sandwiches and lunch mains priced under $20. They serve brekfast all day, and offers Asian menu which features the favorite items as Sweet and Sour Chicken, Chow Mein, and Egg Rolls.

Overall not bad at all. A great place to relax and have a nosh.

As I was staying at the Tropicana, my buddy and I decided to have our one good Vegas dinner at the hotel and gave this spot a chance. We were a little pressed for time as we had tickets for a show at a neighboring hotel, so we decided to eat at the bar. We were were very pleased with the food and drinks. He had the BBQ Meatloaf and I had the French Dip. The French Dip was good, the shaved prime rib was tender, and the meal itself was filling. 

I would actually go out of my way to eat here again and the reason being was that our bar tender and waiter, Rolando, was super friendly and efficient. My buddy and I were there for a gay sports festival, The Tropicana is the host hotel for this event, thus I think they put Rolando (who claims he's usually not stationed at the bar) as the main bartender to appease us gays. Mission Accomplished, he was good looking!

well it looks nice but the food and service is horrible!!... after a long drive we checked in and starving found this place got seated under the sun! full summer on! so we asked if we can get seated in the shade! i guess it annoyed them. The waitress didn't care about anything just gave us  her name and walked away.....finally we got to order some drinks and food all together that took a really long time..!... we get our food i got the grilled chicken two of my girlfriends got the same ....the bun was total burnt u would think they be nice enough to cut the chicken into pieces so u can eat it but no way! u get burnt buns a piece of chicken that i can to literally chew like gum!! sooo dry!!!! and my girlfriends got the same! we were starving so we ate what we could! but never again!!! don't let the look fool u! keep in mind this meal was $15! i expected so much better! (I SHOULD HAVE TAKEN THE PLACE ALMOST BEING EMPTY AS A SIGN)

Just had dinner at the Beach Cafe. The staff was friendly and attentive without hovering. I got the Cajun Pasta. The pasta was overcooked but it was strangely comforting, like the kind of pasta you  have a little kid, and don't care what al dente is. The spicy tomato sauce had just the right amount of heat, and was not too heavy. The chicken in the dish was fine, as was the sausage. It reminded me of kielbasa that was cut real thin, but the flavor mixed really well. I loved the shrimp, it was cooked perfectly.
My boyfriend ordered the tofu stir fry. He told me the tofu was very good, but the bok choy lacked flavor.
It was an ok dinner. Nothing too fancy, but perfectly enjoyable at the same time

We enjoyed a breakfast and a dinner here. 

Our dinner service was a big sketchy, but the food was good and the drinks were stiff.
mushroom cheese burger no bun and wings - both good and the wings were the standout!  

For breakfast we sat at the bar - our service was good and the food was delayed. 
Super friendly server, but the kitchen took forever to deliver breakfast taco and a sausage omlette. I will say they were both delicious! 

Still four stars, excellent value of the quality/quantity to price, staff at the bar is super friendly and the decor is relaxed. 

All in all this is a nice place to have a good meal if you are staying at the hotel or just visiting.

Good food. We had a mix of breakfast and lunch - pretty standard. Their all day breakfast menu is a little small, but the breakfast buffet looked good (we missed the end of it by 10 minutes). The best part about this place was the nice service and the waitress who was pleasant and joked with us about the birds outside stealing sugar packets. Overall I was pleased with our experience just the food overall was a little meh.

Surprisingly the combination fried rice was very good! We had a hankering for Chinese food and didn't want to venture out of the hotel. We decided to give the cafe a try and glad we did! The deconstructed eggplant Parmesan was equally surprisingly enjoyable. Our waitress (Flor?) was the right amount of friendly and attentive.

The staff was great with a greeting from everyone. Decor is nice. For business travelers it feels like you are in a Hilton or Marriott and Breakfast prices reflect that. The buffet was $21 which is too high for this establishment and no locals discount. 

An omelet station, great staff, decent choices rate 4 stars but for those on a budget you can find lower prices. A more realistic price should be $14.95 to offer an alternative to the higher priced MGM buffet.

My experience was decent.  The Beach Cafe is located in the Tropicanna where I was staying so I figured I would try it on my first night in Vegas and not venture out. I dined late on a Thursday night and was seated immediately by a extremely professional and friendly hostess. My waitress was nice and enthusiastic.

 I ordered the side Ceasar salad which had way too much dressing but it was decent and a good size. I also had the Pan Roasted Salmon which was a tad over cooked but it had a good taste over creamy mashed potatoes and asparagus with carrots . The veggies were fresh, cooked perfectly and seasoned well . The highlight  of my meal was the strawberry  mojito, it was delicious and if they were not $12 for each glass which was filled with ice I probably  would have ordered  a few more. 

If I was to rate the service alone I would definitely  give this place 5 stars. The food was not good quality  for the price. My suggestion  is if you order the salmon insist they cook it medium rare, overcooked  salmon is ruined salmon.

I can't believe the line to get in and the inability of the servers to turn tables. Long wait and very slow service while the management team stands and the back and watches. 

Food was over salted and limited in the buffet. 

Bar staff was awesome attentive and friendly, I can't say so for the table service. If you go to get your free hilton honors breakfast sit at the bar and order from the menu.

I came here for lunch on Saturday, and ordered a club sandwich.  After eating, my friend and I went back to our hotel (at Monte Carlo) to take a nap.  After about 2 hours, I started getting horrendous stomach cramps.  A few minutes later, I was vomiting uncontrollably every 20-30 minutes for SIXTEEN HOURS STRAIGHT.  It was THE worst food poisoning experience I have EVER had.  I seriously thought I was dying, felt like my stomach was going to come out of my mouth.  I then had a horrible fever for the next 24 hours... what a GREAT way to spend my Las Vegas vacation!  

I reported it to Tropicana, but thinking I probably should have reported it to Las Vegas Health Department as well, I wonder how many other cases of food poisoning there were this day.  Vegas is known for their awful restaurant grade ratings, but I really thought this place would be of high quality being new and being a part of a big casino/resort that had just been renovated.  I still cannot believe this happened, and want to make sure people know this was NOT the stomach flu, as that is HIGHLY contagious and my friend who was with me did not get sick at all (she ordered the buffet of all things, she's lucky she didn't get food poisoning too!).  

NEVER again will I EVER go to this restaurant again, they serve poisoned food!  I just wish there was an easier/better way to prove things like this... and unfortunately for the Tropicana, I do work for a travel agency and our agency will NOT be using the Tropicana for any of our clients again.

I'm surprised at how much I liked this place. It's a cut above your standard casino "coffee shop." I ordered the salmon and a caesar salad. I expected the same old overpriced junk that you get everywhere else in town. Imagine my surprise when I was served an AMAZING Caesar salad with super high quality ingredients and shaved cheese! The salmon was crazy good too. The kitchen was more than happy to make my food low carb as requested (in this case, it meant extra broccolini instead of rice). No issues and good service. The only big negative to me are the super uncomfortable director's chairs. Mine felt old and I kept worrying the canvas bottom was going to fall out from under me! That and the music was WAY too loud. I was sitting underneath a speaker but it was so loud my ears were nearly ringing. Nice location, setting and view; ask to sit by the window.

Long story short: terrible service, gross food. In case you have a minute I'll explain ... was first seated outside by request, when no one came to help me after 5 minutes I walked back in and asked to be seated inside. I had been sitting out by the pool for 3 hours and needed a cool drink and a bite to eat, this restaurant was the closest thing to the pool so I decided to have lunch there. I wish I would've walked across the way to a different hotel to get a decent meal with great service. Unfortunately Wendy was an indifferent & inattentive waitress. I wasn't greeted & she didn't even introduce herself... how do I know her name you ask? I read it on the receipt when she dropped off my bill at the end of my meal. that was a first... So anyway, Wendy literally asked what I wanted to drink in passing & kept walking. The restaurant was slow so I didn't understand her rush. She was just completely rude, no other way to put it. 

I ordered a Cobb salad with no tomatoes, Italian dressing... she ended up bringing me a plate of lettuce drenched in ranch with a few slivers of egg and walked away. There was no "is there anything else I can get you?" as I am used to being asked... she just walked away. Maybe I've been spoiled by California Customer service? Not sure, but she was indifferent & rude. I asked another server walking by if that's how the Cobb salad was supposed to come, I thought I read that it had bacon and avocado as well? He apologized and did his best to fix it, when he came back he said he asked my server and she thought I said no chicken. Yes, I had said no thank you when she asked if I wanted to add chicken, but that didn't mean no bacon. Wendy never came back over to see how I was doing or if I needed anything or even to apologize for the salad being completely wrong. The other nice waiter ended up bringing me bacon crumbles and a side of blue cheese crumbles, which was also missing from my salad . I got my bill for $23 and change and was upset that I had to pay a dime after being completely ignored by my waitress the whole 20 min I was there. the only time Wendy came to my table was to drop off my check and pick it up again. What's up with that?

I stopped to speak to the manager Mark on the way out after he pleasantly told me to "have a nice day" as I walked out. I was visibly annoyed I'm sure, & explained to him that there was a terrible lack of customer service & encouraged him to address the issue with Wendy. Maybe she was having a bad day, or maybe that's just her personality. Either way, she should get it together it at least fake being a nice person because paying customers deserve better. He said for me to come back tomorrow and he'd do his best to make it right. I told him I didn't want anything for free, but the least they could offer was basic customer service. it usually comes with the meal, or at least it should.

Not sure if I will return tomorrow to give him the chance to "make it right " , I honestly wouldn't wish this kind of service on anyone. Sad.

Kat, you're AMAZING, woman! LOL! Seriously, one of the best experiences of my life! They often say, good things come to those who wait, and, oh boy, let me tell you you, whoever "they are" had it right! So, what started damn near disastrously, ended awesomely! My college friends (Indiana University- Bloomington) and I met a group of friends here for lunch. Actually, we were in town for the Mayweather fight. One of my girls had met a guy out the night before, and he invited us to a pool party at Tropicana Hotel. So we arrive and realize that he is friends with a "celebrity". I say quote, unquote because he is a new cast member on a semi-ratchet reality show. Any who, he was being a complete dick to the staff at Beach Cage the entire time, but he was being "pretty cool" with my crew and I, so I wasn't really tripping. Now, in all fairness, I get that Beach Side makes their dishes on an order -to-order basis (as most restaurants should), but our food took forever to come out, my calamari kind of, (and not to be funny, but if you check my 80+ reviews, you'll find that at least 10, if not more, mention calamari), any-who, the texture of my calamari was similar to Gordon's fish sticks. I also used to live in Florida, so when it comes to seafood, I'm pretty to the beat in that dept. Any who, they also forgot to make my girl's fish tacos. Naturally, we were all pissed, but ole dude took is way out of proportion. THEN, we met the wonderful manager Kat! She is so awesome, and really good at her job. I can totally see why she is the manager. Not only was she able to successfully get the "celeb" to take a chill pill, she was also able to bring my girl her fish tacos just in the nick of time for us to make it to the pool party. Kat was able to rectify the situation in about 20 mins or less, which is certainly to be commended given the fact that we were 20+ people deep. Thank you Kat for making this experience so amazing ;-)

We were at the Tropicana to see a show and stopped here for dinner. The hostess and our waitress had no personality at all. The waitress spoke broken english so we had some trouble communicating. The guy who was delivering water and busing tables should have had one of their positions as he smiled and and was very attentive.
We both ordered the prime rib dinner. The baked potato and vegetables were typical coffee shop fare. The prime rib was tough and hard to chew, not a good experiance overall.
Fish tacos were great. Relaxed atmosphere. Nice beer selection. Watch sports in the bar area while you have lunch. Service from Dexter was exceptional.nothing not to like for the price range.

Eaten here twice both times for to go food. First time got the Cuban sandwich with fries. Pretty yummy but had no pickles on it :( . Today I tried the chicken blt wrap and side salad. BAD. It was so awful I didn't even eat it. The lettuce in the wrap was soft and soggy. The side salad was a joke. It was 7 pieces of lettuce, 1 grape tomato, 1 sliver of cucumber and 2 onion slivers. Yes I counted.  It would have been delicious if it took me longer than two bites to eat. Plus the bartender (his name started with an R) seemed like everything was a burden. Not a good attitude. 

Overall: will not return, two chances was enough. 

Quality control needs to be improved.
We ate lunch here. It was okay. Nothing really special. Service was good. Nice/clean environment.

This restaurant located inside the Tropicana has an eclectic beachy atmosphere.. from the beach chairs to the square plates.....It has a great view through the windows of the palms and lounge area outside....I had the grilled pork chop , which was topped with bacon apple chutney...it came with mashed potatoes and veggies....I thought the pork chop was a little dry, but there again I'm a kinda gravy guy....some would think opposite....the food was a little slow coming even though the Cafe was almost empty....but that was ok....because I want my pork chop to be nearly well-done....great restaurant to relax...as it was very quiet.....all in all ...almost a 4 ...but not quite.....

Unfortunately, my boyfriend and I had a 50/50 experience at the Beach Café. As we normally do, we ordered in detail and specifically stated that we did not want any type of sauce or condiments on our entrees. Both of our sandwiches came out with an overdose of mayo (the WORST condiment of them all) and mine for some reason had a thick butter on it (the SECOND worst condiment of them all). We obviously can't eat them because we just geek out with that kind of stuff and had to sit there for exactly 33 minutes and wait for our waitress to come back. We feel as if she saw that we weren't eating our food and due to the amount of tables she had she stayed away from us and basically ignored us until I stood up and went to another waiter and had to ask for the manager. He did not take anything off our check and did not give us the sandwiches we requested (new ones), just simply asked for us to wipe it all off. 

Enough said.

I went here a total of 2 times during my stay. The first time, there was goo on the floor by the omelet buffet on which I slipped and fell. The personnel were not very concerned about me, but seemed concerned about if I wanted to file a report. I wasn't that hurt, just stunned. The food on that trip was okay and the coffee was good. The scenery was somewhat peaceful, but the seating wasn't very comfortable-they had canvas director chairs for seating. Two days later, I saw the same goo on the floor, but avoided it. I stuck with the fresh fruit on the breakfast bar instead as that was good. Don't think I'd want to come back when there are many other options in town we went to that appeared cleaner and more courteous.
Slow service but food was good. Nice seating outside too. You need to have time on your hands because you're not going to get your food fast. Approx 30-45 min

This beach cafe is one deeeeelicious cafe. The service is quite friendly and nice, that's always a bonus to have! The food though oh man. So I ordered the corn beef benedict and it was heavenly.  Now I can eat a lot for my size but this plate oh man. It was so filling with the hash potato and egg benedict. Sad to say I finished half. It was so delicious I was upset I couldn't finish all of it. 

My gf ordered a breakfast place I think called trop combo. It came with like 2 of everything, heck it needed another plate for the pancakes. Another plate for the pancakes! Her plate was so stuffed with food it was insane! 

The prices are decent although paying $4 for orange juice is quite something. We didn't get a chance to sit outside as we had our luggage with us. I would probably sit outside to eat and soak in the vitamin d! Definitely a great place to try if you're nearby!

I wish I could put a - stars for this establishment we waited forever for cold food. My friend ordered a well done burger and got a bloody mess. Asked to speak to manager he took off the burger and gave a discount on the cold food. Really? This is all to common to discount and not care! Don't waste your time by eating here. If they don't care why should we!

Seated right away. The meat loaf had a pleasant mushroom gravy w/good plain mash potato. Veggies were broccollini & miniature squash! The stir fry was mild but very healthy/vegeterian. The tofu was fried & pillowy.  No rice served with it. They have a bar that looked filled with patrons.

Went for breakfast. 
Considering the Buffett was free, I won't complain. I wouldn't pay for than $15-$20 for this buffet though. It's a standard breakfast buffet with two buffet stations and an additional omelet station. The pancakes and waffles were sitting and easy, not fresh, made to order. 
The rest of the food, including he drink/plate service was great! The guy working the omelet station was awesome and had a great variety of ingredients to add. 
It could be great on good weather days, sitting n the patio outside next to the pool.... Maybe I'll be back...
Food is good and low cost. Management and service are poor. No communication between staff and customers. Only come as last case scenario and I'm eating to go.

First time ever staying at the Tropicana, I was running the marathon on Nov. 17th and that Friday Nov. 15th had to work in my room. I had called for room service like 11am but to my surprise it never ever came. So me and my husband met some friends at the Beach Cafe for a starving lunch and after I had told the hostess how are food never came to our room she immediately told her manager, and he came over and apologized for the missed service and comped our meal, the four of us meal. I had the bacon and eggs dish called the Deuces 2Xeggs2Xbacon or sausage2Xpancakes special that is not on the menu but they have it 24X7 like for 6bucks or less I think. Our server was pregnant and very attentive to our needs. I have been in the food service business for over 10years in Los Angeles area. I was very impressed by the service and also the team management of the Beach Cafe, and Tropicana Hotel. I will always come back and spend my money here because I do appreciate good and great quality customer service when I stay or play in Las Vegas.

I wish I could review the food, but after being seated on their outside deck after 2pm on Tue the 19th of March for 9 minutes, no service, no water, no menu, just a quick, 'I'll be right with you' and forgot about us, we walked out.  

I can understand if an establishment is busy and the servers are slammed, but there is no excuse, it wasn't busy at all.

I reward good service and good food, and I do the same when I get terrible food and no service.
This is perfect for those who want a buffet (my brother) and those who do not (myself). Terrible service, cheap(er), and nice decor. I felt like I was at a beach, really. No sand though!

Here with a conference and decided to come here to avoid the other lunch crowds. Although the burgers were very tasty, our salads did not come out until it was past time for us to leave. We were here a total of 90 minutes. Manager offered 35% discount of the burgers. Hm. Very nice people but will not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

We dined here for lunch one afternoon while staying at the Tropicana. There was a 10 minute wait, which was fine, and we were seated on the patio as requested. Our server was friendly and helpful, and suggested we check out the buffet. It looked great, but we both decided that we wanted to order off the menu and got the chicken quesadilla and the chicken ceasar salad. The food came out promptly, and tasted very good, but my boyfriend found his salad to have WAY too much dressing. It was so bad that he couldn't even finish it as he started to feel sick! The service was great, and the rest of the food was delicious, but the salad was too much. It was a bit pricey, but that's Vegas for ya! All in all it was good, I would return and wished we had for breakfast but unfortunately just didn't have the time. The menu looked great, and the patio was gorgeous!

PROS: Decent food, especially the brunch buffet which makes excellent omelets.  

CONS: (1) Absent-minded and/or uncaring waitstaff.  Except Wendy.  She's awesome; and (2) extraordinarily long wait times for food.

I stayed at the Tropicana from 9/25/13 to 9/30/13 when I was getting married.  If a bunch of us needed a quick bite to eat we headed down to Beach Cafe, but it only proved that there was no such thing as a "quick" bite.  We came here at various times of the night and day, each time the waitstaff was barely there and would disappear for eons.  The food took forever to come, even when it was just two people eating.  They didn't seem to care that our party would wait in excess of 30 to 40 minutes for food.  (Only one time did we get a nice waitress and that was Wendy.  Tip her well.)

The buffet is quite nice when it's offered and I suggest you go that route otherwise you'll be stuck waiting for them to bring you something.  The omelets are great and the chef is very friendly.   

One of the few conveniences with this place is that it's right in the hotel, but the drag is that you have to plan ahead knowing you're going to Beach Cafe, and that you're willing to not start your day's errands and visits for at least an hour to 1.5 hours to account for the wait time.

We had our wedding reception here in September 2016. This review is long-overdue! (sorry Pat!) We had our wedding ceremony at The Tropicana LV Weddings. Our wedding planner connected us with Pat Bishop, catering manager for Beach Cafe. Pat was instrumental in seamlessly coordinating our special reception.  Mark Arnold, the manager on duty, was organized and made sure everything was timed perfectly. Excellent communication and planning.

We were given several packages to choose from, and we reserved the patio for an early dinner for 60 guests. The food and service were phenomenal. I can't rave enough about our good experience. Prices were extremely reasonable and our package was inclusive of tax and gratuity, no hidden costs, no surprises. We paid our final bill in full the day before the wedding, which is nice because there was no worrying about settling anything after the reception. 

We gave our guests the choice of grilled 10 oz NY steak, cajun pasta (chicken, penne, shrimp and sausage) or honey balsamic glazed salmon. Choice of appetizers included chilled jumbo shrimp or petite caesar salad. Our package also included a self-serve beverage station with domestic and imported beers and house wines. Great value for the price, perfect for what we needed. We added on 6 bottles of Moet Chandon for the champagne toast.

Met with Mark in person twice prior to the wedding. We discussed final logistics and confirmed our order. I dropped off favors and he had them placed at each seat. He also arranged our name place cards for us so I didn't need to worry about anything. Also he made sure our personal cake topper was delivered to the pastry chef. 

We had beautiful full sized decorated cupcakes for a $60 upcharge. We were allowed to upgrade from a standard tiered wedding cake to cupcakes on a stand, and we included a 4 inch round cake for us to cut. The cupcakes were so elegant and perfect!

The food was amazing, everyone was pleased. The patio is spacious and comfortable. Waitstaff were prompt and attentive. We were very impressed with this venue for our special day. Huge thanks to Pat and Mark for a beautiful event.

We had a late dinner/snack here and very much enjoyed the food and friendly waitress. I had the Angus sliders, yummy and just the right size. The rest of our party had Turkey Dinner, Fish and Chips, and French Toast.  All of their meals were ample portions and could have been shared for a smaller appetite. The prices are very reasonable by Vegas standards and I would definitely eat here again.

Pretty lame... went here for breakfast since the only other choice inside the hotel was a long line at the Starbucks.  The choices were either the $25 breakfast buffet, or off the menu.  I ended up getting the Cuban breakfast sandwich thinking that it would be interesting.  Well, it was bland and tasteless.  I don't think it was even roasted Cuban pork.  It tasted like a ham and cheese sandwich with a fried egg on top.  My wife got scrambled eggs and hash brown's, which was pretty standard.  Breakfast for two...$42.  I don't recommend this place... stand in line at Starbucks and get their breakfast sandwich,  or go across the street and see if there's anything better at the MGM!

Good food but a very slow kitchen. Even though the restaurant was not that crowded the food service was exceptionally slow. Our server was excellent but the kitchen moves at a snail's pace.  It was a late lunch and we both ordered the tri-tip wraps with fries. It took about 35 minutes for our food. It was however, excellent! The roasted poblano peppers in the wrap and tender tri-tip made it. I don't know if the kitchen is always slow but just in case, be prepared to wait.

I am giving this buffet one star !!!
The hot food was cold... Coffee was the color of light tea ( you can see through it !!))) and taste like water 
The food stations were dirty ... Spoons , plates ... 
Very sad... Vegas has standards and this is definitely not the one...

My party and I ate at Tropicana multiple times during our Vegas stay. I really think for that end of the strip, this place is the best bang for your buck for both breakfast and lunch. We have zero complaints!

The Beach Cafe is surprisingly gorgeous and I loved all the modern tropical details. They have a large balcony for outdoor lounging and eating as well on a cooler day. The staff is accommodating, friendly, and move quickly despite how busy this place can get especially during breakfast hours.

The food is really good! There are plenty of options, and a lot of then are healthy. I didn't try the breakfast buffet, but it tempted me quite a few times. I recommend their sausage as a side - something about it is just delicious! Perfectly cooked and as non-fatty as sausage can be.

I would recommend Beach Cafe for the budget conscience Vegas visitor, and anyone else who wants a satisfying and healthy breakfast.
Nice location and interior. Food is just OK. We had waffles and eggs Benedict. Waffles were mediocre. Eggs Benedict was fine, but nothing special. Coffee was weak. Service was fine.

Huge portions, friendly staff.  It seems that they recently renovated the inside and the place looks really nice.

A nice, affordable place to grab a bit.  Can definitely share a sandwich with another person.

Came here for breakfast because we stayed in the Tropicana hotel.  The buffet cost $21.95 plus tax.  It is totally not worth it. Other than the egg station, they only have very basic food like fruits, sausage, croissant and bread.  The only interesting fruit was papaya.

I brought my guest that attended my wedding to this Cafe since my wife and I got married in the courtyard June, 2017 in 120 degree weather @ The Tropicana LV Weddings, not a great experience since it was scorching HOT! Fortunately they were not too busy and were able to accommodate our group. Unfortunately they did not have a lunch buffet like we wanted, however we were still able to order from their menu everything tasted amazing and was relatively affordable. Definitely had a pleasant experience. Service was great. Gave it 4 stars due to how long food took to order and come out.

On Sunday, Dec. 4th, my wife and I decided to have breakfast in your cafe. We were staying at a hotel across the way and wanted to see the new look of the Tropicana. A number of years ago, I had my bachelor party at your location. The restaurant was quite packed due to the marathon race and bull riding fans. We actually had to wait 45 minutes. The restaurant staff was awesome. The waiters were at our table with all of our needs and I watched them assisted the other patrons regularly. The food was excellent and your hostess who had to run around appeasing everyone kept a smile the entire time. We will be returning to Las Vegas in February and will be back to eat in the Nikki Cafe.

You know the service is bad when the waiter brings you your coffee.and OJ once you have finished your meal. Also saw other patrons that had to get up and track down the waiter for service. Must be a little under staffed.

The food was standard fair. Music was a bit on the loud side and difficult to carry on a conversation.

Lastly one of my peeves is when the waiter brings you your bill in advance of you finishing your meal and you then have to make an effort to flag them down to pay.

We have been staying here at the Tropicana for the last 4 days and our experience in every other way was great.

I came here for dinner with my husband before watching Raiding the Rock Vault. The location was convenient and parking at Tropicana is easy and free.
For dinner we split the General Tso's chicken entree and the pot sticker appetizer. For dessert, we tried the Smore Pudding.
Everything was fine but nothing stood out. For the price, I expected better quality.
Horrible food service and drinks. Had the lobster macaroni it was ok. Shrimp fried rice was disgusting and the calamari was drenched in nasty marinara sauce. Boooooo. Rip off

Came on two separate occasions during my stay here....

My first experience was in the middle of the night around 3am and we had a craving for late night cheeseburgers! The burgers were made to order perfectly-juicy, flavorful, burger awesomeness that all drunk people crave and enjoy. It was served with fresh cut fries and everything was devoured in a matter of minutes shamelessly. Our service in the middle of the night was horrible however.... she was yelling at us from the bar and never refilled our drinks or bothered to even bring our checks. We decided to throw down enough cash for meal,tax, tip, and  bouce out of there. 

Our second experience was much better in service. We were greeted with a friendly smile and seated right away. We took a quick look around the breakfast buffet and decided for the price of around 18 bucks including cost of drinks it was a great deal in Vegas. The made to order omelette station was fantastic! Everything was very fresh on the buffet from fresh fruit, granola, bagels, eggs, bacon, and smoked salmon. My favorite was the fruit rolled up crepes. It was stuffed with cream and peaches and sooooo delicious! My friend sampled the blueberry one and went back for seconds.

It was St. Patrick's Day and we wanted to eat the traditional Corned Beef and Cabbage. We got lucky that the dish was a part of their special menu for the day and we didn't have to go out our hotel. The service was quite friendly. The only problem was they were very slow. We waited half an hour to get our food. I did get my soup quick, but half an hour afterwards I was sort of, "really?" Then the food arrived and it wasn't really that hot. It was, but it got cold easily. Overall, it was an okay experience. Knowing me, I'm being generous with that comment.

On a recent 1-night stay at the Tropicana my whole family ate dinner at The Beach Cafe in the Tropicana Hotel. We were too tired and hungry to venture too far. 

We were very disappointed! This one time Yelp let us down. We expected better, based on Yelp reviews. Half of us ordered food along the Asian theme. Ewww! I've had better Asian-themed food at fast-food chains, and that is not saying much. I should add we live in San Diego and have all sorts of excellent Asian-themed family-run restaurants here, so maybe we are spoiled.

If you must eat at The Beach Cafe in the Tropicana, don't order the Asian food...it's over--priced, relatively small portions, and not that great.

Stopped by this place after watching a show at the Tiffany Theater. It is a very nice Cafe with a nice selection of menu items. Open 24hrs, this is a new competitor for all my late night dining haunts. 

They had a Chicken Matso soup and a clam chowder on the menu that night. The Chicken Matso soup was delicious, light pieces of chicken in a great tasting Broth with Vegetables and a couple of tasty Matso balls. I would definitely have this again. 

Appetizers were the Lobster Corn Dogs and the Lobster roll. The Lobster Corn Dogs were done just right, not gooey around the Lobster meat, the Lobster was nice and sweet but not overcooked and the Corn Batter complimented very well. The Lobster Roll which is like a Cali Roll but with lobster substituted was OK. 

For the entree I had the glazed Mahi Mahi with Rice and Vegetables, which was good. The glaze was a bit sweet but the Mahi was done perfect. Two small fillets nice and flaky, heated right but not dry. I was satisfied with the portion size too. 

Desert was a Waffle and Ice Cream stack, I forget what it was called but it was good. 

The service was excellent quick to get our food and our drinks never went empty. We liked the decor as well, it had a modern beach feel with natural and stained wood which always reminds me of home. 

Overall a really good spot that I will definitely go to again.

Very un-assuming 24-hour cafe inside of the newly renovated Tropicana Hotel.

This is by no means a Grand Lux (at the Venetian) but it gets the job done.

The food isn't bad, but the prices are kind of hefty for what they serve.

Last time my husband and I had sandwiches and the total came out to about $35. I'd rather pay a little more to get Grand Lux quality food.

However if you're in the area and you're hungry, this isn't a bad choice.

This place is nice and peaceful during breakfast time and had a nice view where we sat to the pool. They also have a cute outdoor seating. My boyfriend and I got there around 9am since we couldn't check into our room until 2pm. I give this place three stars because the food wasn't anything special, but for the price pairing to the quality, it wasn't worth it. My boyfriend and I spent over 40 for breakfast that was just sausage, eggs, toast and pancakes. I had the traditional Benedict that wasn't anything special either but the hash browns were probably the best tasting thing there. Service wasn't bad except when I asked for
Ketchup I didn't get it for awhile until I asked a different server. Probably won't be back because it wasn't anything outstanding.

It was empty when we came for dinner so the food was really fast which I appreciate. The service was decent. I had the smokehouse burger - medium rare and it came with bacon and cheddar cheese. Pretty standard and it was priced fairly for what it costed.

Everybody else seemed to find their meals alright. The food was what you'd expect and nothing terribly wrong that stood out to us. The service was on point with our waitresses topping up our waters often and asking if we needed anything periodically. If you're in the area and you're craving something quick and not overly expensive to eat, check this place out!

We came for lunch before a show with our 3 children.  There is not a children's menu so my two ordered and shared off the appetizer menu.
Service was VERY slow and took forever to have our food order taken. First she brought waters and said she would be back and after about 15 minutes she finally came back. She seemed to be chasing her tail and not getting far. 
The food was ok but nothing great for the price. It is near the pool area and has an ok view. It was also very loud and we were in the back next to the doors to go out to the patio. 
All in all, it was better than fast food but I would not go out of my way to have it.

The breakfast buffet had a top notch omelet station. They were generous with the omelet toppings, and the veggies (spinach, peppers, mushrooms and onions) were so fresh (unlike some places where it seems like they use soggy frozen veggies). Awesome food and great service to match!

This is the best place to eat at the Tropicana.  Not cheap, but nearly reasonable. I had breakfast three times, and all three came in under the price of the buffet, and I came away very satisfied.  Good staff, good food.

This restaurant is fine.  Probably the best in the Tropicana, which isn't saying much.

Like everything on the strip, it was pretty expensive.

The staff were good.  I sat at the bar, and the bartender was professional and ran a tight ship.

Food was so-so.  I had steak and eggs for dinner, which is hard to mess up.  They didn't have much in the way of hot sauce (no green tobasco or sriacha), which was annoying.

#1 complaint:  Hotel wifi doesn't work down here, and AT&T cell reception was spotty.   I would have given another star if they'd install some access points for WiFi down there.

This restaurant was okay. It was not my favorite the food was good, but the atmosphere was kind of an after thought. There are buffet bars every where and from what I understand, this is where they have their breakfast buffet each morning. It seemed like they were like hey that space is empty in the evening lets just put people in seats and see how it goes. I am sure it is nicer at breakfast. The service, however, was not an afterthought. It was very good. Our server did a great job and was quick and courteous, considering we were on our way to a show and did not have much time to eat. If we are ever in the Tropicana to see a show (they closed the great show we went to see) then we might venture back, but it really is not anything to right home about considering all of the other great options in Vegas.

Beach Cafe is a 24 hour cafe inside the Tropicana. I was here with friends for the RuPaul Drag Race Season 6 Finale and we were just dead tired and needed some food even though performances were still happening. 

To our luck, this was the entrance and staging area for all the dragqueens performing! So we had much better of a time chatting and taking pictures with our queens here than standing some more outside starving. 

Got Da Club which is a turkey club sandwich with a side of fries. It was standard, but good. Good amount of turkey and bacon in it and the fries were those kind I like, crispy but yet soft.  Prices are strip prices, even in a smaller property like this. 

Angela H. got some sliders, and our friend Matt got Cajun pasta which came with cornbread. 

Our server was really friendly, helpful and attentive. I think that he was better than the  food.

Really busy yet only 10" wait. Friendly check in and attentive staff. We added 3 to party mid way and no response except smiles.  Food quality high. Standard omelette station. Fruit and usual stuff.  Refills on drinks prompt.  Hilton Honor members get free breakfast.  All buffet in here. Opens at 0600-1100.

$21.95
Nice open area bar tvs nice good variety of refreshing cocktails to add to the meal . Today was a watermelon lemonade with vodka rum. Delicious!

The buffet is limited for the price. If u have car venture to M casino studio B breakfast or lunch buffet m- th. For a good deal there.
 The waiter/server was top notch, food was okay nothing to write home about or worth the wait. Will not return...

Came here with 2 other friends after a night out. I was a bit hungover but I needed something to each.

The Tropicana kind of smells.. but the Beach Cafe itself is pretty nice, and has a nice beach decor to it.

The breakfast selection is not huge (only 4 items) but they all seem pretty decent. I got the eggs sunny side up. It came on top of hash browns with a bunch of bacon on the side, and some toast. The bacon could have been better (a bit too crispy for my tastes), but overall pretty good.

If your a frequent visitor to Vegas then you know that the service is expected to be high quality and food selections bountiful.   There are a lot of really good buffets and tons of deals to be found.  

I am only rating the Breakfast buffet as this the only time I are here.   

The buffet is fairly extensive and the food quality was good.  The omelets were cooked to order at a separate station and the cook was talented and polite.  

The service was lacking.  It took 8 to 10 minutes to get drinks after being seated and from that point until the check came I never saw her again.   Disappointing.   The other disappointment is that for $21.95, there are so many other places to find a great buffet.   Many of the station Casinos have a $7 buffet that blows this away for comparison.  I figured I would give it a shot since we were pressed for time.   

Overall, the meal was good but the price is high and service low.  Maybe your experience will be better?  

Enjoy!

This is our 4th year attending a sports competition at the Tropicana, (love the hotel), and the Beach Café is the convenient "go to" place for breakfast or a quick meal when we don't feel like "dining out" at a nicer venue.  The casual atmosphere is great, with an upscale feel, but . . . wow . . . every year we hope the food will get better, and it never does.

The food is just mediocre and, in some cases downright bad.  We're not talking about the breakfast buffet, which is standard and fine, but items ordered off the overly large menu.  When will restaurants learn that you can't be everything to everyone?  Order a BLT or a Burger and they're fine.  But, if you dare venture into the Mexican, Asian or other parts of the menu . . . watch out!  The Udon Soup or Pork Fried Rice are VILE.  (Sad, really, because there is nothing better to soak up excess alcohol than a nice Fried Rice).  The Mexican themed dishes have no flavor.  The wraps are dry as logs.   I don't think the staff has a clue how bad the food can be.

Service is prompt and friendly, if occasionally a bit harried, so the issue at the Beach Café is really the food.  It you go for the convenience, and order judiciously, you should be just fine.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. First night we went to the bar.. there are NATS at the bar flying around sitting on the straws! OMG! ew! We left the bar to eat in the dinning area thinking it was cleaner.. well we got sat and waiters didnt even bother with us.. we didnt complain so dont think that we were ignored because we were jerks.. no.. she waited 15 mins.. didnt even ask if we needed anything and we left.. never again!

I was shocked...SHOCKED I tell you... to walk into the renovated Tropicana and find a casino that didn't remind me of the floor of a tropical rain forest--dirt, decay, and things growing that might well kill you. It was really nice!

I wandered around a bit, looking for a light lunch and Cafe Nikki seemed to be my only real option. I was greeted, then seated at the bar where the lovely bartender--Shannon, I believe--took great care of me.

And when I say lovely...well, I mean that literally. In fact, the whole place is beautiful. It's shiny and new, bright and cheery, and classy. Spacious, with nice finishes. The place practically sparkled! And so did the staff. From the hostesses to Shannon in her form-fitting dress, to a waiter I saw (tight shirt to show off his chest) in the area to the delicious runner (hi, Cody!) who brought my food. Truly a feast for the eyes.

The place was fairly dead around 2pm on a weekday. A smattering of tables, and 2-3 other people at the bar. So service was very good. My ice tea (just the regular kind, I was giving my liver a brief respite) was refilled before it ever emptied. My salad was brought out right away. I never wanted for anything.

The prices were reasonable--for a restaurant in a hotel/casino on the strip. And my tea ended up being gratis, so even more so! The food was also good. My side salad was fresh, with just the right ratio of greens to veggies. And the greens were NOT iceberg lettuce, which is a good thing. My $14 "Philly style" Cuban sandwich was delicious and generously sized without being ridiculous. I recommend it! (The sandwiches include your choice of side salad, fries or fresh fruit. I love having options!)

My only complaint, for a 0.5 star deduction, is that they wouldn't seat me outside. They said I could sit "by the window". Other people were outside, and there were open tables.... Not sure what that was about.

Overall, 4.5 stars, rounded up to a very elusive 5 for not only a painless, but pleasant solo lunch experience. Thanks, Nikki!!

friday morning tropicana arrival...remodeled and leaving old past behind...familiar traces of past present...beach cafe and wanting light brunch...a la carte option available...single egg over easy $three...small egg and cooked picture perfect...runny yellow a spoonful...corned beef and hash $five...canned or bulk variety...a pillow of soft ground corned beef and hash...mush consistency and chewing not required...not bothered for $five corned beef and hash...still enjoying the atmosphere and service at the bar dining...recommend the filet mignon wrap...cheesy deliciousness...tender beef... $17 before tax and tip

This place is what you except with some awesome decor! I will say it is quiet and far enough away from the casino that you can actually relax at a meal with out all the hustle and bustle. The menu was some what limited but everything we ordered was good! We ordered breakfast and a Philly cheese steak. I think Id order this again! The service was average, took a good amount of time to get refills but other than that Id recommend it.

My friend and I came here for dinner on New Years Eve. After wandering the halls looking for the Benihana-style Mizuno's and finding it had been closed, one of the staff members (tucked was in the back of the hotel) suggested we try three of their restaurants. One was a steakhouse, one was Italian, and the other was Cafe Nikky. After browsing the menu at the other two places we found that the steakhouse was more expensive than we would have liked. The Italian place offered nothing special and wasn't taking reservations until 8:30 (it was 7pm at the time). We decided to hit up Cafe Nikky before making our final decision. Upon checking out the menu and the decor from the hostess station, we were sold.
The restaurant was pretty empty, a plus in our book. The decor was beautiful, modern with a beach flair. We sat at a high top table that looked like polished drift wood (no square high top tables, very nice). There was a mix of light, sandy colored wood and dark stained wood making for a nice ambiance. The servers were all dressed stylishly in khaki and white while the manager was in all black and the hostesses in form-fitting brown. Our server was very attentive and amazing! She never let 10 minutes go by without checking on us and had an excitement about the restaurant that one rarely sees in this day and age. She helped us make all of our meal decisions.
The meal:
Appetizer- fried calamari. it was perfectly crisp, yet chewy in all the right ways. it was large enough to be split but small enough to keep us hungry for dinner. the dipping sauce was incredible!
Dinner: she had the seafood pasta. it was generous with the seafood (clams, shrimp, and scallops). All of the seafood was cooked perfectly. The pasta was in a nice, light lemon alfredo sauce (if I'm not mistaken). she loved it.
I had the steak frites. I got a nice sized steak, a perfectly cooked medium. The fries were crispy and delicious. The veggies on the side (broccoli, mushrooms, string beans, bell peppers, and asparagus) were cooked perfectly with a nice sauce. The portion was generous and filling.
Dessert: we had the chocolate napoleaon, or as our server referred to it, "the adult s'mores". whatever you call it, we loved it! the napoleon was made of nutella wafers with chocolate fudge and vanilla pudding sandwiched between. accompanying the amazingness was chocolate gelatto , and homemade cinnamon candied marshmallows. everything was amazing about this dessert. the marshmallows added a sweet and spicy touch to the creamy chocolate. like the appetizer, it was enough to share but wasn't a heavy dessert. a nice end to dinner.

The thing about Cafe Nikky that floored us was the fact that it had been open for less than a month. Most restaurants that are that new are disappointments, not here. The service, food, wine selection, and drink menu and price were great! We spoke with the manager and complimented him and his staff on a job well done. the restaurant we ate in was a fraction of what it will be by the summer. They're adding two patios, one with sand and beach chairs to eat at. We'll be going back for sure!

A little backstory: we came to Vegas for my 21st birthday (some 5 years ago) and happened upon Mizuno's. We all loved it; my brothers, my best friend (who appeared in this review) and our friend, Nikky. Since that amazing weekend, our dear friend Nikky passed away so visiting Mizuno's was a must-do anytime we were in the area. Unfortunately it was closed, as previously discussed. Call it fate, call it divine intervention, call it a sign, but we happened upon Cafe Nikky and absolutely loved it. Now, it's our new must-do and a fitting tribute to the beautiful woman we lost. Love you Nikky!!!

In a city where prices follow the formula of (airport + movie concessions) x 2 = bend over, this hotel's $18 all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet isn't so bad. 

Especially when you factor in the variety of choices, quality of ingredients, and proximity to the bed you rolled out of. Bottomless coffee included -- whoa, not that kind of bottomless!

We never waited more than 10 minutes to get in, and HiltonHonors members of some reasonable level (Gold, I think?) got in right away.

Yet another reason I'd stay at the Tropicana again!

I love their breakfast. It's just a different experience from the get go. A light place away from the casino. Nice ambience with the option to sit outside. The Buffett has everything you need to start in a busy day. Fresh fruit, omelette station etc. Nice staff.

We chose Cafe Nikki for our in-hotel dining and were pretty pleased with the experience. The atmosphere is casual and laid-back, and I really liked the light streaming into the restaurant on our late lunch/early dinner visit. We had the Philly Cheesesteak, the burger sliders and the mac 'n cheese poppers. Everything was delicious and done right - and reasonably priced, too. The mac 'n cheese poppers were especially appealing and were a hit with our group. Service was attentive and friendly - we were served by an all-male crew :)  I'd go back if given the chance.

great service and great quality food.  

the continental breakfast was delicious and plentiful

The waitress was amiable and friendly however... 
Despite the "modern" and "paradise-esque" atmosphere this place wish to emanate, my overall experience with here was far from paradise. 

Greeted with tacky paper menus, my family and I were confused with the prices. Surely the " 19, 20 " s on it weren't indicative of the prices right? Wrong. Anyways, let's start with the beverages. Coffee was bitter and too bland- my parents got diarrhea from it. Same with my hot chocolate which seemed way too rushed to make. 

With the food... ugh. My older sister ordered these  breakfast tacos and no salsa was served. We requested salsa but they didn't have salsa; just age old Tabasco sauce. Don't even think about serving  Mexican cuisine if you don't even have the essentials. -_- The breakfast platter my dad got had undercooked sausage and bacon. We had to request the cook to grill them more. 

Also with the tacos, the chorizos were doused in oil. They were so mushy and gross looking... 

The blueberry pancakes I ordered were really stale and hard... it was hard to eat them. The blueberries also tasted really sour... 

Horrible food. Boring atmosphere. Sick tummies at the end. What more could I say? Not coming here again. Not to mention the food is waaaaay overpriced. Step it up.

It was food. I had the past dish with shrimp, chicken, sausage and supposedly sauce. Pasta was the best part.chicken was fatty, sausage had tough casing, and very little red sauce. Over priced for the product.

Food wasn't bad but service and kitchen takes so so so long. There were only a few tables with customers so I can only imagine how long they would take with a full restaurant.

Not too bad priced to be inside of a hotel and gorgeous if you sit outside.

One of the few bright spots in the New Lackluster Tropicana.  Food was good and the service was attentive enough although it could have been better.  Sad to say but the decor and ambiance is so much better than the rest of the hotel.  Here it's more modern, cleaner, and smells better than the Casino or my horrible hotel room.  The food was fresh and my organic heirloom tomato bisque soup was clean. This restaurant seems out of place, its almost too nice to be in the  Tropicana in its current condition. Very sad to see an Iconic hotel struggling through an identity crisis with the modernization of the new Las Vegas.

The brunch buffet looked quite tempting...though the desserts seemed a bit dry (my friends tried it) and the macarons weren't made correctly (shape is off, but tasted delicious). The omelette station smelled wonderful, and the fresh fruit and smoked salmon stations were a big plus! The breakfast options seemed a lot more enticing than the lunch/dessert...I opted for a healthier option:

Fresh fruit: I asked for no bread/muffin as I'm allergic to gluten. The plate of fruit came out super skimpy and not so awesome...but the waiter probably saw my reaction and brought me another bowl of fruit! He provided amazing service and was very friendly and approachable!

The other random foods I tasted/tried were okay (the grilled veggie sides that comes on the entrees are pretty good, though I like my carrots a bit firmer). Overall, not a bad place to eat if you are at tropicana, but not somewhere I'd go out of my way for.

I'm torn on my review.  3 for food, 2 for service.  I had the opportunity thanks to a generous 100.00 food credit from the hotel to dine here 5x in 3 days.  I got a good taste for the menu and the service.  Some things were great, some not so great.  Let's just say that if I was a paying customer, I wouldn't be too happy.

Sunday Breakfast
Because of stomach surgery, I can't eat huge portions anymore.  I asked to order off the kids menu and was allowed, no problem.  I ordered the kid's French toast and my spouse got the 2 egg American breakfast.  Eggs scrambled( they didn't taste fresh though, they tasted like they came off the buffet), hash browns, 4 pieces of bacon and an English muffin.  My French toast was supposed to come with berries, but they were missing.  I saw the server take a bowl off the breakfast buffet and bring me some berries.  The price for the 2 egg breakfast( 14.00) is very expensive, the kids French toast was 8.00 and came with 2 pieces. 

It did take forever to get the food and the check.  

Sunday lunch
I came in alone because spouse wasn't that hungry.  I ordered the grilled chicken pesto sandwich as a wrap with no tomatoes.  It came 15 min later, full of tomatoes.  I was left to eat the fries while the wrap was taken away to be fixed. It came back another 20 min later without tomatoes and also without the pesto.  I was so tired of waiting and because I ate a few of the fries while waiting, I just packed up the food and took it to the pool.  The sandwich was bland, no seasoning at all on the chicken.  I was told I didn't have to pay for this meal because of the mix up. 

Monday lunch

Ordered the same sandwich.  It came another 20 min later, this time without the cheese or bacon that is supposed to be on the sandwich.  It was also so soggy, I was starving and just wanted to go back out by the pool so I ate my half, wrapped up the rest for my spouse and left.  Very pricey for 15.00. 

Monday dinner

Ordered a ceasar salad with the dressing on the side and a turkey burger with no tomatoes and cheddar cheese instead of pepper jack.  The salad came as a small pile of romaine leaves, shredded parm and a piece of focaccia bread.  No croutons.  I had to ask for the croutons and they were brought out, no problem.  Salad was overpriced at 5.00.  The turkey burger was decent.  We shared that and enjoyed it( 16.00).    

Tuesday Breakfast

We had about 45.00 in credit left, so because we were checking out, we just went with the extremely overpriced breakfast buffet( 21.00).  This was not a buffet like you would expect to see at a Vegas Hotel.  Very basic.  I did have an excellent egg white omelet made by Kenny,  I wanted a small omelet with little oil and no brown what so ever.  He made in perfectly.  I also wanted my mini bagel toasted and that was no problem.   It would be really nice if this restaurant had some healthier meat option like turkey bacon or turkey sausage.   The oatmeal was hot and fresh and there was a ton of fruit and healthier items, like yogurt and cottage cheese.  

This isn't a destination restaurant by any means, I've stayed at the Trop about 10 times and its the first time I've eaten there.  I only did it because of the food credit.

I really dug this place. Located in one of the smaller scale resorts on the strip, I initially had low hopes for a restaurant with such an underwhelming name. Day one I got a gooey grilled four cheese sandwich on sourdough and a gin and ginger made with ginger beer. I also drank a few of their mojitos, including a lavender one. All entirely delish and entirely too drinkable. Day two they had a 15 buck all you can drink mimosa deal, so I splurged on that with the smoked salmon dish for brunch. A huge spread of smoked salmon, tomatoes,  red onion, avocado and cream cheese complete with a bagel was presented. I was quite pleased with the flavor and quality, minus the fact that you could tell the avocado had seen better days. But, I am a bit of a produce snob. Overall, it was one of the more decent restaurants I ate at!
The portions are great! Had Lobster Tails and The Cowboy Steak and couldn't finish them. But they were great! I'd recommend it!
The food was ok. I got the teriyaki chicken bowl and the chicken looked undercooked and it was dry. It took a long time to get our food and it was pricey. I don't recommend coming here.
